dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IRVING ROSENFELD, not a small man, gets dressed and meticulously constructs his combover. Camera WRAPS AROUND see his hands with rings adjust his dark velvet suit, up his face, serious, concentrated, intense, he is composing himself before a performance. Irving is now dressed, ready, and walks down the hall to another room.

dialogues.speaker: SECOND PLAZA HOTEL ROOM
dialogues.text: Irving composes himself -- looks      into cramped surveillance closet, there are FBI Agents -- only see their hands and arms -- he looks at monitors -- a BLACK AND WHITE IMAGE OF ANOTHER ROOM ON MONITOR: MAYOR CARMINE POLITO, swath of salt and pepper hair, cream suit pinky ring, Rotary Club pin -- ALONG WITH CARL ELWAY, pre shady businessman. He exhales pressure, turns as CAMERA PANS TO: SYDNEY PROS (who will also be known for some time as EDITH GREENSLY), stylish crafty smart. They stare at each other intensely they have a deep and emotional relationship. A DOOR BANGS OPEN, and in walks RICHIE DIMASO, Bronx-born. He stands there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing, going behind my back? Telling people I'm screwing up this operation? I got you a suite at the fuckin' Plaza Hotel!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shittiest suite at the Plaza Hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shittiest fuckin' suite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Based on what--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the food is wrong, and--What is this? You, like, went in my closet or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you dressing him like you're dressing me now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes her head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, what are you thinking? This isn't all about you, you know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, did you try to dress me so I would look like him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you're not dressed like him, all right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I do, I look like him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he's in like, velvet. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You asked me to show you how this was done, you wanna fuck it up be my guest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, look, I never laid a hand on her, all right? Is that what this is about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (British accent)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well technically, that's not true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, we never had sex ok? I just --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHIE DIMASO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd I do? I put my hand like this -- Richie reaches out and puts his hand on Irving's face ver carefully, not forcefully. Irving swipes it away violently the second it touches his face. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you fucking touch me. That bothers me -- RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh it does? IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That bothers you? IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, a lot of shit bothers me too, but I was trying to help you. If I wanted to bother you, if I really wanted to fucking bother you, this is what I'd do. Richie takes his hand and destroys the combover Irving sp so much time creating. Irving just stands there, hair rui staring at Richie. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't have done that. Irving just stands there staring at Richie, hair all wild messed up looking very angry. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's that? You bothered now? (no answer) Alright, don't make a thing of it. EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't touch him. He doesn't like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god, fix his hair. Don't make a thing of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It takes some time, ok. Edith walks over to Irving who is still standing there in silence with his hair all over the place. She carefully starts helping him put it back together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big fucking deal. We got to get in the other room, come on. The mayor's in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I know that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we go to the beauty parlor? Is that what we should do? Richie walks over and opens up a briefcase that's sitting the dresser. Inside are stacks of cash. Edith is still helping Irving put his hair back together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's it look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look fine. Richie slams the briefcase shut looking very nervous and intense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLOW MOTION -- DOUBLE DOORS PUSH OPEN AND Edith ENTERS TH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought he was going to be here. I do business face to face, person to person. That's just who I am. Richie reaches down and awkwardly slides the briefcase ov to Carmine unprompted. LEAVE MONITOR'S POV AND RETURN BAC THE SCENE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, excuse me, excuse me. I'll handle that for the Mayor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's for the Mayor. It would be a sign of disrespect to the sheik if the mayor didn't take it himself. It's for you Mayor. Carmine looks angry and confused. He looks over to Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? What-- (to Carl) Carl, what the fuck? What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'll handle it. I'm gonna take care of-- Everything's good. I got everything under control. (TO RICHIE) That's for me. I handle all that for mayor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this? Irving looks over and says nothing. Not surprised at all badly this is all going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edith whispers to Richie. EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers to Richie) Just stop it, ok RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers to Edith) He's gotta take it himself, okay? CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what the fuck that is but it's weird you understand? CARL ELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Misunderstanding. Misunderstanding. CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I came here to meet a sheik, that's all I know. I'm very interested in that but he's not here apparently. Carl?! Carmine turns and starts to walk out of the room. CARMINE POLITO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm very interested in meeting the Sheik. You let me know when THAT could happen! Thank you, have a good day. Carmine leaves the room. Irving looks over and shrugs his shoulders. Not surprised all the way this is going and horrified that Richie has ruined it. CARL ELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leaving) Irving! You better come get him. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stares at Irv) Go out there and get him right now. CARL ELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me get him back! RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go get him. He needs to take the fuckin' briefcase, Irving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't wanna do it in the first place. This is your show, YOU go get him. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you have no choice. You have to go get him. Now, go get him, so he takes the briefcase by himself! That's the whole plan, Irving! Irving stands up angry and gets in Richie's face. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you doing pushing the fucking briefcase, dummy? Huh? RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The whole fuckin' thing was falling apart. You know how much I paid for this goddamn hotel that you fucking asked for?! IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I gotta go mop up your mess. I'm gonna go fucking mop up your mess! Irving storms out of the hotel suite towards the Elevator get Carmine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irving paces back and forth as he waits for the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We push in on the concerned face of Sydney as Richie ramb on to her. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You understand what I'm saying, right? It wasn't working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irving continues to pace back and forth in the hall waiti for the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you ever have to find a way to survive and you knew your choices were bad? Irving walks over and hits the elevator button again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I learned how to survive when I was a kid. 7

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My father had a glass business.

dialogues.speaker: IRV AS KID SMASHES PLATE GLASS WINDOWS OF BRONX STOR
dialogues.text: Drumming up business for his father. EXT. ROSENFELD & SON GLASS REPAIR CO. - DAY 1940'S Young Irving and his Father and Mother standing outside t family's glass repair shop in the Bronx as some tough contractors march up to them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would rather be on the taking side than the getting taken side any day of the week, especially after I saw how my father got taken. I mean, seeing that scarred me for life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Young Irving runs by a store front as he throws a rock through each window on the store, smashing them all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took it upon myself to drum up business. I became a different kind of guy than my father. I became a con artist -- from the feet up, for real.

dialogues.speaker: THE BRONX
dialogues.text: Irv shakes his head, surveys the damage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was gonna survive no matter what. I still had the glass business and a few dry cleaning stores on the side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irving paces around his office smoking a cigar and talkin the phone. What looks to be stolen art sits on the floor around him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I did some art dealing on the side. Stolen or forged art.

dialogues.text: GUYS WHO LOOK MOBBED UP, pale, out of shape, gold chains, swim trunks, EVEN MORE BURT REYNOLDS TYPE GUYS, slim, hai chains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, one January I go to my friends pool party in Long Island. Irving sits holding court with some friends by the pool w he turns and sees Sydney for the first time. PUSH IN ON: Irving. He looks up, they lock eyes across th party.

dialogues.speaker: SYD REACHES FOR A SLICE OF FRUIT ON HIGH SET PLATE WHEN
dialogues.text: IRVING'S HAND GRABS HER ARM -- she turns, taken aback -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that Duke Ellington on your bracelet? She does have on a Duke Ellington charm bracelet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a matter of fact, it is. He died this year, you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I doubt anyone else here knows or cares about it. SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I care. He saved my life many times. Irving takes a good look at her, impressed. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impressed) Mine too. Which one? SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeep's Blues. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles, warm) Jeep's Blues. Oh yeah. Awkward pause. IRVING ROSENFELD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna hear it? SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right now? IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: Irving and Sydney nod to it - he watches her foot in her wedge and her tanned leg rocking as she sits on arm of so IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who starts a song like that?! SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's magic. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Magic. They listen to the record, Edith checks Irving out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wasn't necessarily in good shape, and he had this comb-over that was rather -- elaborate. He had this air about him. And he had this confidence that drew me to him. He was who he was and he didn't care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like me, she was a very particular person. Like me, she came from a place where her options were limited -- and she had been someone she didn't want to be in her past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It actually can feel kind of sexy sometimes. There's a boldness in it. But where would that boldness take me? I didn't know. But I was gonna find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like me, she learned to survive and reinvent herself. She knew she had to reinvent her life and her identity. And like me, she envisioned a better elegant future for herself. Like me, she knew you had to have a vision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sydney looks at scrap of paper with info in her hand -- l up at office building address -- enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She came to New York. She envisioned it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And just like that, she applied for a job at Cosmopolitan Magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clean bright colors, huge blown up Cosmo covers -- Sydney -- innocent, plain, slacks and blouse, hair back, nervously awaits interview. SHE IS CALLED IN -- NERVOUSLY STANDS, small crumpled scra paper in hand, FIXES HER HAIR --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you're obviously here for a reason. Let's get to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our cover story right now is on cunnilingus. What do you think about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any clerical skills?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you type?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was unlike anybody I ever knew. She was smart. She saw through people in situations. And she knew how to live with passion and style. She understood Duke Ellington.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 15   CUT TO: Edith WATCHES A COSMO COVER SHOOT --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was broke, fearless, with nothing to lose --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irv and Sydney dance slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and my dream,   more than anything, was to   become anyone else other than who I   was.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. LONG ISLAND DRY CLEANERS-- DAY
dialogues.text: Irv holds the door open for Edith as she enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I got two in the Bronx and three in Manhattan. (to an employee) Hey, Byron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had a chain of dry cleaning stores. He asked me to come in and upgrade my wardrobe-- he said a lot of nice things got left behind by people and forgotten over the years-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean you wouldn't believe the shit that people leave behind here. Unbelievable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People leave stuff here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. They go out for the night, they drink, come here in the morning, put their clothes in and then they forget. They got no idea where they left it. Irving touches a hanging blue sequined dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at that. Sequined thing. I don't know. Is that nice or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beautiful. Irving and Sydney continue to walk through towards the ba and enter a fur vault filled with elegant designer clothe IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, some of it's been here for years. They're not picking it up. Nobody's picking it up. Sydney starts riffling through nice things hanging on the racks. IRVING ROSENFELD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You like that? SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love it. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's yours. You want it? It's yours. Sydney looks back at Irving in shock.

dialogues.speaker: FURSTENBERG DRESS
dialogues.text: IRVING ROSENFELD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You look fantastic! SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god. I can only dream about these dresses. They're beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: MAGICALLY AROUND THEM. THEY STARE AT EACH IN LOVE.
dialogues.text: IRVING ROSENFELD (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I felt like we had a secret. Just the two of us. You know like that thing where you want to just be with the one person the whole time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You feel like the two of you understand something that nobody else gets. I could just tell her everything about myself. And I never had anybody like that in my life before. I felt like finally, I can truly be myself without being ashamed, without being embarrassed. 39   INT. Irv's dingy office - DAY Irv leads Sydney into a small, dingy Manhattan office on upper floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this place? Do you sell art here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sometimes. This is my office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know it's your office, but, you have these other places. What's this for? Why did you bring me here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This getting to be my main business, my growing business. I help get loans for guys that can't get loans. I'm their last resort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're their last resort? Because interest rates are north of 12% and heading to 18%.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right, smarty pants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fucking Jimmy Carter. Fucking Nixon really. And the war and the deficit and all of that shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, you're so smart. You are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks kid but how do you get them the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't do you? You don't. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These guys are lousy risks, you know? I can't get them a loan but I get my fee. Five thousand. SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five thousand? You take five thousand and you don't give them anything? IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are bad guys, you know? They got bad divorces, gambling habits, embezzling, all that shit, you know what I mean? SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody at the bottom crosses paths eventually in a pool of desperation and you're waiting for them. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about `we'? SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We? IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How bout it? Sydney turns and begins walking out the door as Irving ch her out. IRVING ROSENFELD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sydney. Sydney I'm sorry that was too much. I went too far. I didn't want to upset you. She continues walking out without looking back and leaves IRVING ROSENFELD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sydney please, I'm sorry! I know it ain't for everybody. The door slams in Irving's face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IRVING ROSENFELD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Irving shouts to the closed door) Ah GOD I love getting to know you!

dialogues.speaker: SITS BACK.
dialogues.text: IRVING ROSENFELD (TO HIMSELF)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I do that for? I fucked it up. I should never tell a woman the truth. She's so smart. She's different.

dialogues.speaker: IRVING STARES UP HER TENSE
dialogues.text: SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said it was nice knowing me. You said it was nice to meet me. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. SYDNEY EXTENDS HER HAND TO HIM IN A ROYAL FASHION. SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (British accent) Would you like to meet Lady Edith Greensly? Irving looks stunned as he slowly clasps her extended han SYDNEY PROSSER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (British accent) I have royal banking connections in London. I'd love to help you with your loan but of course I have to be very selective. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was fucking fantastic. SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Did you like it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I liked it. I didn't think you were coming back. Thank god you came back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wasn't going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I fucking love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ONE OF SYDNEY'S NANNY FRIENDS, REBECCA, walk out of a BUSINESS MAN's (34) house pushing a stroller as the busin man comes chasing after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so Irving and I began our partnership -- in love and commerce.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rebecca, hold on. You're Edith right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He told me to tell my friends I had (in British accent) London banking connections

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Jim. I'm her employer. Listen - - she told me you can get me a line of credit. I know you have banking connections in London, England.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And after that...say "no" a lot until the guy is hooked. Edith and Rebecca start walking away as the businessman chases after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Becky tell her! I've never missed a check!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (walking away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was almost scary how easy it could be to take money from desperate people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edith extends her hand to greet ANOTHER BUSINESSMAN, 35. Edith is dressed in a more sophisticated high end British fashion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady Edith Greensly, it's so good to see you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady -- your ladyship -- thank you again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These are the roles that we were meant to play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another desperate businessman sits across from Edith and Irving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're very selective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a strong application. We'll talk about it. INT. IRV'S DINGY OFFICE - ANOTHER DAY, ANOTHER MARK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't take a deal that I can't close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not being aggressive enough in putting up your assets -- The man looks nervous -- NERVOUS LOAN APPLICANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever been to Queens? Have you ever been to Great Neck? Everybody knows my dealerships.

dialogues.speaker: BUT THE SETTING REMAINS THE SAME AS THEY CON MARK AFTER M
dialogues.text: A desperate man takes out a BUSINESS CHECK BOOK and write his check. DESPERATE MAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five thousand gets me fifty right? ANOTHER BUSINESSMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five will get me thirty five. Is that right? ANOTHER BUSINESSMAN, 35

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five grand gets me fifty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sydney and Irving laugh and celebrate. IRVING ROSENFELD (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was doing so much more business with her. I mean it doubled, then it tripled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sydney -- hair getting bigger -- goes over the books with Latino Man who nods and watches her -- Edith counts cash in the register - recounts it -- explai how things can be done better as DRY CLEANING WORKER nods Irv watches happy. IRVING ROSENFELD (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I never met anyone, man or woman, in business who was so careful and precise about everything. Every stylistic detail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irving and Edith discuss a piece of art they're in the process of selling to a businessman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We kept selling art together, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really a fabulous example of a genre painting, which is really rare for the time. It's a boy and his dog. Non-religious painting. 55. Golden age. Dutch painting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paul Klee. Bauhaus Movement. 1920s.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before we go any further, is this legit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just say it's missing from Spain and leave it at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't show any Spanish friends. Irving and Sydney kiss passionately in front of the middl aged car dealer as he tries to hand them his check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean it just took off. We got an elegant Manhattan office. We called it London Associates for her accent.

dialogues.speaker: A JANITOR FINISHES POLISHING SILVER PLATED LARGE LETTERS
dialogues.text: LONDON ASSOCIATES to a pale wall as he and Edith sip champagne from flutes and offer one to the worker who toa with them.

dialogues.speaker: TO QUIET DELIGHT OF SYDNEY.
dialogues.text: Irv and Edith kiss gently, lovingly, sincerely on the lip They walk into their CLASSIC LOOKING, STAID, PRIVATE BANK OFFICE SUITE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I was around her I felt joy. Fucking joy! And love. That's what I felt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 47   They dance down Park Avenue together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irv and Edith dance through the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: THE PIERRE HOTEL CAFE
dialogues.text: As they dance among mostly older wealthy couples on the s dance floor of the elegant restaurant as a live jazz quar plays "I've Got Your Number". Camera circles them, puttin their foreheads together, very happy. THEY SING TO EACH OTHER quietly as they dance close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irv and Edith make passionate love, we see in pieces -- He gets up, she watches him dress and leave --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 53   He drives over the Triborough Bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As, as far as I could see, people were always conning each other to get what they wanted. We even con ourselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 55   He drives through the suburb of ranch houses and dri 56   and pulls into his driveway of his split-level ranch gets out of his Cadillac and walks to the front door of h house --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We talk ourselves into things. We sell ourselves things we maybe don't even need or want by dressing them up. We leave out the risk. We leave out the ugly truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irv walks into the decorated ranch house, frosted glass w bird designs, glass tables, walls, black and brown lacque everywhere. He walks into the house and looks at a pictur his son did -- a drawing of the Yankees playing baseball that is taped to the refrigerator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pay attention to that because we're all conning ourselves in one way or another just to get through life. Irv takes Danny's picture from the fridge and tip toes -- with low sounds now of O.S. TV -- Irv goes to A CLOSED DO WITH YANKEE STICKERS on it -- Irv OPENS A BEDROOM DOOR TO REVEAL HIS 5 YEAR OLD SON, DA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was married, and he had a son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANNY is on the bed, picture books, baseball cards, sprea all around him. Irv stands holding the picture. Danny loo over his shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He had adopted her son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was a really good dad and I respected him for that. It was a tough situation for everyone. Irv's face lights up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny. This is a fantastic picture. What did you do today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That kid Donovan is being mean to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The big kid? I thought Mommy picked you up so he couldn't bother you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was late, and then after we put out the fire, mommy said stay in my room with my baseball cards. Danny reaches across to Irving and takes his glasses off face and puts them on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What fire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know they make a lamp that has the sun in it? [Irv looks at him] Mommy got the lamp. She made her special drink and the lamp made a fire. Irv looks concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irv's wife Rosalyn sits up on the bed in a muumuu, half h face is burned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put out the fire. The fire is out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the first time in my life I do the right thing.

dialogues.speaker: ROSALYN ROSENFELD
dialogues.text: Oh shut up --

dialogues.speaker: IRVING ROSENFELD
dialogues.text: I save a young single mother, and her kid. I marry her. I adopt him -

dialogues.speaker: ROSALYN ROSENFELD
dialogues.text: You fell in love! Don't forget we fell madly in love!

dialogues.speaker: IRVING ROSENFELD
dialogues.text: Yes, I fell in love. My God, I fell in love. Yes. But you know what? I thought you were mysterious like my mother until it turned out that mysterious just meant depressed, hard to reach. I mean, I'm dying here! And you need somebody who's gonna be quiet like you. You're young, you're beautiful. You gotta find somebody else. You gotta go out and get some friends all right? Don't sit inside --

dialogues.speaker: ROSALYN ROSENFELD
dialogues.text: I don't like going out. You know that I get anxiety when I have to meet people. You know how hard that is.

dialogues.speaker: IRVING ROSENFELD
dialogues.text: Yeah but you can't just stay in the house with the fucking sun lamp. Alright? And I can't-- I mean, look, I can't trust you with it anyway. That fire and everything. I can't trust to leave you with Danny.

dialogues.speaker: ROSALYN ROSENFELD
dialogues.text: I put the fire out Irving! There is no fire! Maybe if you were here more, then there wouldn't have been a fire in the first place.

dialogues.speaker: IRVING ROSENFELD
dialogues.text: Oh, what, there wouldn't have been a fire if I was here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just stop with the whole fire thing. God it was a mistake. I'm sure a million people do that all the time. Those sun lamps are dangerous. Shouldn't even have them in the house, really. I bet that happens all the time. This was nothing. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not happy. Alright? Rosalyn just stares there for a moment at Irving saying nothing. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know that I could take Danny. You know that most of your work is illegal. And you know that if you tried to divorce me, you know that-- I'm not saying that I would, but I'm saying that I could. And I'm saying that that is why I don't like divorce, Irving. Women do that in divorces. Women get the children, and then the fathers never see them. My mother never got divorced. My grandmother never got divorced. There are NO divorces in my family. I am not getting a divorce. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on. What are we doing here? ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We fight and we fuck and that's what we do. That's our thing. IRVING ROSENFELD (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was the Piccaso of passive aggressive karate. She was better than any con artist I'd ever met including myself. And she had me like nobody had me. Rosalyn sheds her muumuu, to reveal a white leotard. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irving, come to mama. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might say she was my karma for how I took advantage of people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irving, come here. Come on. Get into bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 63             Baby, there's such good stuff here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did not want to leave the kid behind. He was my son. She had me. I was her mark.

dialogues.speaker: HEAD AS HE FACES SYD AND IRV.
dialogues.text: WE NOW SEE THE MARK: A charismatic, mercurial, wild eyed BUSINESSMAN "MORT PAPIERMAN" in need of a loan. Mort's eyes go from her knees to her eyes -- His eyes mee Sydney's -- he looks soulful, open. She stares at him. Ir notices uncomfortably. He's JEALOUS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and every deal I take, I close. However, my fee is non refundable, just like my time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (filling out paper work)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to thank you very much Irving for seeing me. Sorry I'm so nervous. Richie reaches for his top button to adjust it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MORT PAPIERMAN/RICHIE DIMASO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I not buttoned? Edith stares at him and smiles. MORT PAPIERMAN/RICHIE DIMASO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just gotta say Mr. Rosenfeld, that Lady Edith was very adamant that you were top notch and -- IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's correct. MORT PAPIERMAN/RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really need your help. I'm desperate. I've got the Audis for collateral and the two boats, and I forgot to mention that I have a little piece of real estate in Long Island. EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you didn't mention that. Two lunches and you never mentioned that. MORT PAPIERMAN/RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I was gonna mention it and then the guy with the hat walked in. EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hat. MORT PAPIERMAN/RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I forgot totally. It was the second time we had lunch. EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You couldn't see his eyes. He had no eyes. It was like, did he make it? MORT PAPIERMAN/RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Do they sell hats like that? Where do they come from? Actually, I went to the store that I thought maybe he bought it there. I was gonna get you one -- EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were going to get me one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MORT PAPIERMAN/RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like as a memento. Irving decides to interject. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two lunches? EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. It's two lunches. What's the big deal? IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's unusual. EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was trying to get him to be more aggressive. On his loan that is. Mort PAPIERMAN/RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You showed me a whole new side of the city I'd never seen before. EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, good. You're welcome. Mort PAPIERMAN/RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, thank you. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right. You liked it? Should I take you there? EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should I take you there twice? EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop.

dialogues.speaker: CONFIDENTIALLY TO HER.
dialogues.text: IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confidential to Edith) What's going on, you like this guy? EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I like this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that messing up your judgement? Don't be stupid. SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he's not messing with my judgment. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, play your part. EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. You play your part. MORT PAPIERMAN/RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holds out cashiers check) Take it to your people in London. Please, take it to them. I got the cashier's check right here. I give you five and you give me fifty right back, right? Please. Please don't reject me. Give a guy a chance.

dialogues.speaker: STARING AT SYDNEY STARING AT MORT. MORT HOLDS THE CHECK I
dialogues.text: THE AIR UNCOMFORTABLY AWKWARDLY UNTIL -- almost in slow motion --Edith takes the check -- staring at Mort. IRV ST

dialogues.speaker: TO LEAVE -
dialogues.text: MORT PAPIERMAN/RICHIE DIMASO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zurich? You got an office in Zurich? Paris? I can call Paris? IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you could excuse me for one second? MORT PAPIERMAN/RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, take your time. Do whatever you need to do. Go ahead, take your time.

dialogues.speaker: THE OFFICE --
dialogues.text: AS Edith OPENS A SIDE DOOR -- BANG - FEDERAL AGENT STOCK WALKS HER BACK INTO THE OFFICE WITH A WARRANT. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got the wrong office, you're gonna be embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I may not have you, Irving, but I have her on fraud. Impersonating another individual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fraud?! Fraud? What is that? Identity fraud?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You may be from England, Edith, but you're not royal and you have no banking connections and that's a felony. How long is that? That's 3- 5 years I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (about the handcuffs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Not so tight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh really? That's interesting. I don't even know your real name. Richie pulls out a badge and shoves it in Irving's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richie Dimaso, FBI. Nice to meet you. Richie looks at Edith with concern and points at Irving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta get away from this guy. Agents take boxes of files out of the office- Irv standin alone in center of room- shell-shocked. 64   INT. FBI HOLDING OFFICES - DAY. SYDNEY IS LED INTO A HOLDING CELL BY AN FBI AGENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wouldn't let me see her for three days. He even managed to delay a lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dim cell, lit only from small high barred window, no ligh on. Edith looks like she's coming apart -- circles under eyes, a shadow of her confident self -- pale, scared, hai flat, stringy, unglamourous, pacing, rocking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 65             She couldn't handle it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLUORESCENT LIGHTS COME ON IN THE CELL -- Edith squints. is unlocked by Richie Dimaso WHO enters with a cup and sa of tea. He stands near her with the tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the other side of the two-way mirror)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joe, how come the fluorescents are on? Can we kill that, please? (to Syd) Jesus I put this lamp here for you 'cause I thought it'd be better for you. There's a wire here. They're scared because people hang themselves but I know you're too smart for that. Where's the table and chair? There's no bed here? It's like a fucking asylum. Joe, is everybody off today? Jesus Christ it's scary. Maybe I wanted to scare you. I don't know. Maybe it was my idea. Maybe i'm a little off the beaten path you know? I don't know. You look dehydrated. Here, want to try some tea? Oh yeah, your lips are all chapped. (re: tea) It's herbal. My favorite. Richie bends down to Edith who is sitting on the floor in corner and hands her the cup and saucer. She lifts the cu but her hand is shaking almost violently as she raises th cup to her lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you think -- look at me. Hey. Edith.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHIE DIMASO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you think Irv loves you. I know you think you know him -- that he sees the world as a cold, dark place, and he cares about nobody but very few people on his short list: his son, his father, Rosalyn, and you. And you think you're at the top of that list. But what if you're not. What if you're not even on the list at all? He'd be in here right now if he took the check. She thinks about this. She trembles. RICHIE DIMASO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'd be in here right now if he took the check. But no, you did. God, it's, it's so clear to me. It's so crazy -- it's clear to me, but it's not clear to you. He uses you, Edith, to protect himself. To protect his son and his wife in Long Island. No? Yes. He put a ring on her finger, he adopted her son. They have huge house, they have two cars. What does she do all day? I'll tell you what she does -- she plays with her nails, she watches T.V., and she spends your money, the money that you make. Edith stares at Richie, taking this in. RICHIE DIMASO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like that you're in jail while he's going free. I don't like any of that. I want to help you. All the razzle-dazzle that he does, it's not good. It's not real. It's fake. It's not real. Who you are is who you are, between you and God. You and your soul. That's what matters. That's what counts. That's what I'm about. And that's what I see in you. Tell me you didn't feel it the first time we saw each other. Am I crazy? I don't think so. I'm not supposed to be talking like this, but I don't care, I break the rules. Edith looks at Richie in silence as she thinks about what he's saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, Edith? Edith. I want to help you. I like you. (whispers) I like you. (dead serious) I like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irv stands alone on the other side of the glass staring a Sydney. Richard Dimaso walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been in there three days. Hasn't been so good for her. Irv continues to stare at Sydney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How does that make you feel her in there? That check was for you, right? But you knew somethin' was off. That's 'cause you're good. You're, like, the best at what you do in the whole country, aren't you? Irv looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you know what? If the country were run by people like you, Irving Rosenfeld we'd be living in Eastern Europe or Guatemala. You ever been in Guatemala? You ever been in jail in Guatemala? You ever try to get a telephone or a permit or anything in Guatemala? That's what this country would be like if we let people, let the liars like you, run this country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who made you god and judge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My grandmother lived to be ninety- three years old. Never lied in her life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. I'm proud of that, too. Does that make her not a good person? Is that not something to strive for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you breaking my balls? Get to the point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see something in you, Irving. I get very excited. I think that we have a lot of potential here. Now, look. I came up with the idea. It's all from me. I want to change things. I want to go after white collar crime. Irving, you're very skilled. And I want you to teach me and we can do this. I want four people that do what you do. Fraudulent investments. Fake certificates of deposit. Stolen art, fake art. You get me four people and you're off the hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four busts and you'll leave us alone? We don't have to testify?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're good, you're done. Anything you want. But if you run, then your life is over. You'll be hunted, and it's gonna be very difficult for Rosalyn and your kid to live in this country.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A NICE UPPER EAST SIDE apartment. Sydney has finally chan her clothing from when she wore the same dress at the hol cell. It is quiet in the apartment - faint street noise f 3rd Avenue below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to leave. We need to run and we need to do it now. We can go to Estonia or Romania, I don't care, we'll take the cash from the bed and get out of here, alright? We talked about it a hundred times.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irv stares at her and struggles. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Danny? SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Danny? IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I adopted him! I gave him my name! I'm not leaving him with Rosalyn, she's unstable! SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a manipulation! Rosalyn's will never let you go. She'll use Danny against you because she's too messed up to let you leave. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't leave him. I love him. Alright? He's my son. SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richie said you would say that. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richie? What, the cop? Your on a first name basis with him? SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I am. I'm not even on your list am I? IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What list? SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your list. Your short list. Your long list. I'm not even on anyone of your fucking lists. I thought you loved me. I thought we had something. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do have something. I love you, it's perfect! What are you saying? We're gonna go to Romania? We're gonna take Danny? SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes, that's what I'm saying. You, me, Danny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you never said that before. SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm saying it now. We're us, and we can make it an adventure like we did. We can make it an adventure like we make everything, alright? But we have to go now. We have to leave right now. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't leave Danny. I'll lose custody. SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to take me away! We have to leave! (sobbing) What are you saying?! Oh my god. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?! Please! Sydney goes storming out of the room and down the hall of apartment. Irving follows. SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe this is happening. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say I don't love you because that's bullshit! SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sobbing) This is bullshit. You are bullshit. We are bullshit. She starts sobbing, shaking. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't do this. SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just never thought you were conning me. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could never con you. I love you. Please don't say this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irv walks to her and bends down to join her on the floor she sobs. SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm done. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say that. SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cries) I'm gonna do these four busts, these four cons, to get us out of this. Not just me, but us. And I'm gonna get really close with Richie, the cop, in case we need to use him, if we need another move. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't need another move. We need four busts, and we're done. SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are going to need another move, trust me. And you're going to be thanking me. (shifts to British accent) The key to people is what they believe and what they want to believe and I want to believe that we were real, and I want to believe that a man could want me. And I'm gonna take all of that heartbreak, and all of that sorrow, and I am going to use it. And I'm going to make Richie think that I want him, and that I like him, and I'm going to be very convincing -- And I'm pissed at you. Sydney reaches over and carefully grabs Irving's face lovingly which quickly turns into a slap as she continues SYDNEY PROSSER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I'm pissed at you! Irving stares at Sydney with confusion. He's never seen h like this before. SYDNEY PROSSER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I do like him -- Maybe I like him a lot. From the feet up right -- baby? Sydney gets up from the couch and storms back to her room

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite your belly aching and come up with something to get us out of this. And you're right -- I'm in no state to deal with this so what's it gonna be, Mister Mastermind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 69             An Arab sheik? Why do we need an Arab Sheik?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richie, in sharp lapeled suit, chain on his neck, walks w Irv and Edith and joined by a man who looks like an ARAB SHEIK who they trail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you think this works, stupid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you could not call him `stupid' which he's isn't, he's smarter than you. Last I checked he's in control here and we work for him now so be nice. Richie stares at Edith elated that she just stuck up for He's really enjoying this position of power she's putting in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stares at her, upset)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, to set this up and bust a con artist we have to make the honey pot to attract the bees. In order to attract the bees, we need to offer them a wealthy individual who can be taken advantage of, someone special, someone new, someone amazing. Then those guys will want to sell fake bank CDS to THAT guy, take the sheik's money, see? Richie looks at Irving uncertain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only they can't get into his money unless you they know someone, and that someone is us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh that's good. RICHIE DIMASO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So if you want to get somebody like your con artist friend -- Carl Elway -- you get him to want to buy-
IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep your voice down. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- or sell fake art or stolen art or fake certificates of deposit, he needs -- who does he need? -- he needs a rich sheik guy, and there you go -- we can pinch him! IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, but I don't tell Elway shit. I wait for him to call me. The art world is a small world -- and one of Elway's acquaintances is clocking us right now. Richie starts to look around. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where? IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look. Richie looks anyway and sees ELWAY'S ACQUAINTANCE, a man balding, 45 clocking them from the balcony. IRVING ROSENFELD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a good look? RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know the Sheik? IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my friend Al from Queens. AL FROM QUEENS/SHEIK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do aluminum siding and roofing. Richie stares, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irving, Edith, Richie, and the fake Sheik admire a REMBRA painting on the wall. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to show you something. This Rembrandt here? People come from all over the world to see this. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he's good. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a fake. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, what're you talking about? That's impossible. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People believe what they want to believe. Cause the guy who made this was so good that it's real to everybody. Now whose the master -- the painter or the forger? Richie's continues to stare at the REMBRANDT on the wall. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a fake? IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the way the world works. Not black and white as you say. Extremely grey. ELWAY'S ACQUAINTANCE walks up to Irving and the group and steps into the conversation. ELWAY'S ACQUAINTANCE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irving can I -- IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many times I gotta tell you. You can't meet the sheik, alright? Edith sees this and steps into the conversation. EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arthur? Hi. Edith. We've met before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanted to introduce you to Robert Spencer. We're advising the Sheik together. She looks at Richie. Richie offers his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (catching up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm Robert Spencer, advisor to the sheik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL ELWAY, 40, preppie Waspy, very old fashioned with cigarette holder, but something vaguely criminal about hi in his conservative suit, natty white and red striped shi and navy blue tie sits with Irving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this I hear about a god damn Sheik?! Why you leaving me out of this? I gotta hear about it from my friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ain't for you Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean it ain't for me? We gotta do certificates of deposit. I can print as many as you need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is not a one man operation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I can get other guys. What are you talking about Irving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're telling me that you can get four guys to sell fake certificates of deposit to my investor within a week? The camera zooms into Irving's shirt collar revealing a t microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL ELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I can make that happen. Carl Elway can do what he says he's going to do. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's interesting but you know I've got other guys lined up. I've got a meeting with my associates.

dialogues.speaker: SUDDENLY CARL ELWAY'S ASSISTANT, OPENS THE DOOR AND ENTER
dialogues.text: Richie Dimaso and Edith ARE STANDING THERE -- MUCH TO IRV DISMAY. CARL ELWAY'S ASSISTANT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl, his associates are here. He's got a meeting he's got to go to. CARL ELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No wait. Don't go anywhere. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to go. Irving gets up to walk out as Richie and Edith stand in t doorway. IRVING ROSENFELD (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crazy thing about people -- the more you say no, the more they want in on somethin. It is so stupid. Irving looks over at Richie and Edith. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell them, don't worry. Hey you know what Carl just told me? He said he could do this whole thing with four guys within a week. CARL ELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or we could do somethin' much bigger! Richie jumps into the conversation. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something bigger? My guy deals with hundreds of millions of dollars. How much bigger? He walks over to Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL ELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hundreds of million -- I knew you were holdin' out on me Irving! Hundreds of millions of dollars? Like much bigger. Like I'm talking about we say never the fuck mind the CD's and we could have some complete access to something huge. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huge? Like what? (introducing himself) Robert Spencer, advisor to the Sheik. CARL ELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl Elway. Irv stares at Richie with contempt, then turns to Edith, DRESSED TO THE NINES. CARL ELWAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to think of the most undervalued asset in the state of New Jersey today. The rebuilding of Atlantic City. Richie looks over at Irving and Sydney and mouths the wor "WOW". CARL ELWAY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, maybe they, maybe they legalized gambling a year ago but nothing's happening. Irving interjects. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, quit while you're ahead Carl. CARL ELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know the guy. I know the right people who are going to help you out. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose the guy? CARL ELWAY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy is Carmine Polito. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose Carmine Polito?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PUSH IN: STODDARD THORSEN, Richie's FBI supervisor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes his finger `no')

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carmine Polito? Carmine Polito, no. We freeze frame on Stoddard as we HEAR Richie'S VO: AS Richie TALKS WE SEE A SHORT FILM ABOUT Carmine Polito: - PUSH IN: Mayor Polito walks a Camden street waves, shak hands of WELL-WISHERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My boss Stoddard proceeded to tell me that Carmine Polito was the most quietly powerful person in the state of New Jersey. A lifetime native of the very racially mixed Camden, which had become a ghetto, and where he had been Mayor for ten years. A very beloved guy. A guy who never gave up on his people. His father had emigrated from Italy and had stoked coal. - Frank Sinatras COFFEE SONG, 1940s version, as we see Carmine talk to and dance joyfully with his kids and wife breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A big family guy with five kids. They even adopted some other kid. A black kid from the Boys and Girls Club who'd lost his family. I mean, his household was a joyous place. And his wife Dolly, she was the apple of his eye and the center of the household. I mean everyone loved this guy. - PULL OUT Mayor Polito walks up steps of City Hall as he greets a women and her baby; into his office greeted by a couple of AIDES who show him papers to sign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he had a huge heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (giving speech)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The W.P.A. employed craftsmen to paint this during the Depression. Why can't we employ people today to do work like this in rebuilding Atlantic City?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He worked with all the unions. He was the leader of the State Assembly. And he had just gotten gambling legalized in New Jersey to create jobs. 80   -- FLOOR OF STATE ASSEMBLY -- Carmine huddles with o STATE LEGISLATORS, horsetrading and then poses for a pict with other members of the State Assembly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he couldn't get the funds to rebuild Atlantic City and that was his problem. So with our help, he was about to have his hand in the wrong pocket at the wrong time. And to me that meant corrupt

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said grifters and con artists. We're not going after some politician. This is a bad idea, Richard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhh. Look, it's really simple. All you need is to put two million in a Chase account --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- under the Sheik's name --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose two million?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh, just listen. Two million dollars under the Sheik's name, in a Chase account that we control. Carmine calls up on the telephone -- calls the bank -- and he sees that the Sheik is real and he has a real account. Five days. STODDARD THORSEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not taking two million dollars of the taxpayers' money and putting it anywhere for five days, I don't care if we control it the whole time. Richie as he stares at Stoddard in frustration. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stoddard, let us do what we need to do to rule out corruption and to get rid of the payoff guys that are ruining this country. That's my dream. Don't smother it, please. STODDARD THORSEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Richard, I understand your eagerness. I really do. You know I'm from Michigan, right? Let me tell you a story about me, and my dad, and my brother. We used to go ice fishing every November. Ice Fishing. That's what we lived for. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit -- STODDARD THORSEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just listen to me. It's beautiful. You have a little stove. You huddle around, you keep each other warm. You drop a line and you just wait. One year my brother says, "let's go in October." He wants to go ice fishing in October. My dad says, "No, the ice is too thin." My brother says -- I love my brother he says --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand what's happening. You're saying your brother went out on the ice, the ice was too thin, he fell through the ice, he went in the water because he was too eager, and you're saying I'm too eager -- that's what you're saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's not what I'm saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll finish the ice fishing story another time, young man. For now, no Carmine Polito. Go do your job. Richie looks at him annoyed and upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stoddard shot the whole thing down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Edith was a genius. 83   SEE B-ROLL OF: Edith and Richie walk back into FBI b 84   down corridor;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She somehow found this woman who controlled the wire room. A woman I'd never heard of. Way back in a warren buried in the Bureau. This cat lady nobody even talked to. Edith met her in the ladies room and became friends with her. This lady handled all the wires and now, she was working with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 85   Edith and Richie enter to find BRENDA, FBI, MATRONLY EDITH carries a basket of exotic teas;

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHIE DIMASO (V.O.) (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was excited to be included in an operation instead of being on the other end of a memo. It was beautiful. Edith goes to hand her the PIMMS CUP and basket of teas. EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda, hi! BRENDA MCPHERSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi! EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said you liked exotic food, so that's from England. BRENDA MCPHERSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's from England? EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. And I brought you some tea as well. BRENDA MCPHERSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you so much! Nobody ever tells me about these operations, they just say, "Brenda, do the clerical wiring work and don't ask questions." EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to tell Richie about your cats. He loves them. BRENDA MCPHERSON

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my cats?! Brenda starts pointing out pictures of all her cats tacke the walls amidst the wire memos and paperwork. BRENDA MCPHERSON (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that's Harry -- look at him standing up, isn't that sweet? And that's Wendy. She's a rascal. But Barnaby, that's another story. Barnaby plays the piano! RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's impressive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got her to wire two million dollars into an F.B.I.-controlled account at Chase. It'd be there for five days and if Polito called he'd see that the Sheik was real.

dialogues.speaker: HALLWAY OF FBI
dialogues.text: Edith and Richie laugh excitedly as they walk the hallway

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the time Stoddard caught up to us Edith made sure his boss was impressed by my idea. So before he even knew it was happening his boss was calling to congratulate him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm very impressed. That was very smart. The Sheik with the money in the bank is a fantastic...don't be modest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anthony Amado. He was the U.S. Attorney, and he had a major hard- on to make a name for himself. I mean this guy loved the idea of being famous. And Stoddard had to say it was his own idea or he'd look stupid in front of his boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 89   PUSH IN ON STODDARD -- confused, dismayed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, sir, wait, the sheik --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up, pissed, confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made me accept praise from my boss who's thanking me for something that never shoulda happened! Something that I didn't approve!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should be happy. There's imaginative things happening in this office, alright? We're not just working in a box. Richie leaves triumphant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got the two million to put Carmine and the Sheik together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Punk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Laughing Richie and Edith walk briskly on their way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I liked being on this side of the line. But someone had been left out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We succeeded because we stayed small. I got you Carl Elway. He bought stolen art, sold fake bank C.D.'s, that's enough. That's one. I get you three more -- no politicians. Richie and Edith look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna do this because you got no choice. You work for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you keep changing the rules. You're gettin' a little power drunk, Richard.

dialogues.speaker: IRVING ROSENFELD, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You want to tell him, Edith? You want to wake him up?

dialogues.speaker: EDITH GREENSLY
dialogues.text: Oh no, I said we shouldn't do any of it, Irving. You know I said that. So now I support Richie. He's got vision. Do it heavy or don't do it.

dialogues.speaker: IRVING ROSENFELD
dialogues.text: I mean, he's the one ruining America, not me.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE DIMASO
dialogues.text: How the hell am I ruining America?

dialogues.speaker: IRVING ROSENFELD
dialogues.text: Because people just got over Watergate and Vietnam, alright? And you're gonna shit all over politicians again? And just because you want to be a big shot and get a promotion.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE DIMASO
dialogues.text: No I'm thinking big. This is gonna be fantastic. We're doing video surveillance. I'm doing this from the feet up.

dialogues.speaker: IRVING ROSENFELD
dialogues.text: You will never do it properly because you got too much government attitude to be small and sleek. I'm like the fuckin' Vietcong, man. I'm in and I'm out. I was there the whole time -- you don't know it. That's the fucking art of becoming somebody who people can pin their beliefs and their dreams on. And you can't do it.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE DIMASO
dialogues.text: How about a suite at the Sheraton Hotel?

dialogues.speaker: IRVING ROSENFELD
dialogues.text: For Carmine Polito and rebuilding Atlantic City?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE DIMASO
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need a luxury hotel for the Sheik. Come on! RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carmine does back door dealings all the time. We don't have a budget for that Irving! IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta knock the Mayor, the Speaker of the State Assembly -- you gotta knock him off of his fucking feet. He's gotta feel like he's out of his league. What you're offering, this deal, I mean, this is unheard of in the state of New Jersey, maybe even the whole fucking country. A sheik with hundreds of millions of dollars to rebuild Atlantic City -- are you fuckin' kidding me? That's gigantic. And the Mayor, he's going to want to see cash, he's going to want to see it in an account, he's going to want to see it right now, and he will check. And that's why this meeting isn't happening, because to get millions, you need millions. Edith listens intently. EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) We already did it. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned) What? Irv studies Richie and Edith. EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got the bureau to park 2 million for three days -- we got the account numbers. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `We' meaning you and him? RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah we did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, me and that guy. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She showed me. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You showed him our thing? You did that without me? Are you kidding me? EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you going to do? IRVING AND RICHIE LOOK AT SYDNEY, UNCERTAIN.

dialogues.speaker: AT SYDNEY SWINGING HER LEGS ON THE COUNTER AS SHE SITS.
dialogues.text: RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You playing me? Are we doing this? Or you playing him? It'd be very bad for you if you're playing me. EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to have to decide for yourself, kid, I just laid everything out on the table. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all very exciting, I never knew life could be like this. You're wild. You know we're taking down a very important politician. Richie stands very close to Edith - between her legs as s sits on the counter. He puts his hands on her hips, pulls her into him. He takes her hand -- puts it on his face, makes her feel his cheek and forehead with her hand. It i intense. She prepares for him to kiss her but he steps ba They are both excited. They stare at each other. The air thick with tension, Richie exhales and leaves. RICHIE DIMASO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (prelap) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is agent Richard Dimaso, I'm placing $75,000 into this briefcase for Mayor Carmine Polito to procure casino license and building permits for Atlantic City.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the film started -- See RICHIE TALK TO CAMERA IN A CORNER OF THE PLAZA SUITE-

dialogues.speaker: SMASH TO
dialogues.text: IRVING'S EYES WIDEN AS WE CUT TO: Richie SLIDE THE BRIEFC OF CASH, AS SEEN BEFORE, Edith puts her hand on top of Richie's to stop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carmine Polito, upset, storms down the street as Irving catches up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Mayor -- Please stop. Listen, I apologize if that prick offended you. I really apologize. Carmine will not turn around -- Irving catches up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really, I'm all right, thank you. I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm fucking embarrassed to be associated with that guy at all. Can I just say somethin' to you, please? Don't lose this opportunity to fuckin' Florida -- all right? -- because of some bullshit from that punk advisor with his diploma who could never get into the school that we come from. Don't lose that opportunity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you from? IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm from the Bronx. Grand Concourse, Hundred and Sixty-fourth Street.

dialogues.speaker: THIS REACHES CARMINE. HE AND IRV ARE CUT FROM THE SAME CL
dialogues.text: CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a lot of friends that live up there. I go to Tomaso's on Arthur Avenue. You know Tomasos's? IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Tomaso's. CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spicy clams. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. They're always good. CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, they're to fucking die for, those clams. I haven't been there in a while. I like that place. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carmine -- can I call you Carmine? You know, Carmine -- (catches his breath) My fuckin' heart's going from running down the stairs -- I'm not used to running. There's a lotta green grass in that hotel room up there, alright? And all the deals would float through you. You get a serious piece on both ends. You do with that what you will. I live in the real world, I am a family man, I got mouths to feed and everything. But, you know, we just...we gotta grease you directly. No middlemen, no bullshit. It's the Arab way. CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, look, I understand. It's a great opportunity. It's just I got a little thrown by going to have a meeting with somebody who ended up not being there, so --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, listen, I was thrown as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand. I'll deal with you directly. I don't want any middleman or any of that bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like you. Eye to eye. We can do business together. Irv smiles and nods as they walk back into the hotel together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long do you know this guy? You work with this guy before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta work with him. He's the Sheik's man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I still need to meet the Sheik, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going out to dinner with Carmine and the wives in Camden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carmine and myself and the wives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! Without me?!

dialogues.speaker: IRVING ROSENFELD
dialogues.text: He doesn't like you, what do you want from me, I got him to come back and take the money and you got him on tape alright? I can't make him like you. I did my job.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE DIMASO
dialogues.text: Did you tell him you were working with me? That I'm the Sheik's associate?!

dialogues.speaker: IRVING ROSENFELD
