dialogues.text: I just fucking told you he doesn't like you. I mean, let him have a night out with a human being for fuck's sake, he's going to jail soon. You're done with him. You got him on tape taking a bribe.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE DIMASO
dialogues.text: Carmine has got to deal with me, Irving.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE DIMASO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're gonna use Carmine. We're gonna use Carmine to get other people, that's what we're gonna do.

dialogues.speaker: IRVING ROSENFELD
dialogues.text: What?! Like who?!

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE DIMASO
dialogues.text: Carmine's gonna use the Sheik to pay off people.

dialogues.speaker: IRVING ROSENFELD
dialogues.text: Are you fuckin' nuts? What are you say--

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE DIMASO
dialogues.text: We're gonna let Carmine show the Sheik Atlantic City, how he's gonna renovate hotels, and see who shows up. Whoever the Sheik pays off for licenses and casinos, that's who we're gonna go after. We're gonna go after all of 'em!

dialogues.speaker: IRVING ROSENFELD
dialogues.text: More politicians? You realize how fuckin' dangerous that is? There's no fucking reasoning with you. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edith and I were so successful for so long because we kept it just small enough. You are takin' us to a very fucking dangerous place, with very serious numbers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If your that successful, how come you wound up in this room with me? Taking orders from me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're taking your wife out to dinner? Your fucking wife? Did I just hear you correctly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the one thing you heard me say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just find it rather shocking that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I get to handle two wives with one dinner, alright? I take Rosalyn out, she keeps her mouth shut, she sees that my work is legitimate, I get to keep my kid, and I get to keep (pointing at Richie) that fucking wife happy. Both wives happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sydney sits alone in her apartment, hair in curlers and sparks a joint.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richie sits in his bathroom, his hair in tight curlers, a eats a chicken wing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard! What are you doing? Don't eat in the bathroom, I told you so many times! And Diane brought Napoleons for dessert. Come out of the bathroom and pray!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god, what did you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard, the filter is broken in the fish tank. It's a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See, your job is to do the filter, Mom, mine is to do the gravel. When you don't do the filter right all the fish die. See?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't get the top on that filter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've gone over this a hundred times mom --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- and please help Richard to marry Diane so that I may have grandchildren and the Pope may have more followers. And please bless this food that we are about to eat -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's this?

dialogues.speaker: EDITH GREENSLY
dialogues.text: It's Edith.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE'S MOTHER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Sit down and pray properly!

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE DIMASO
dialogues.text: Are you alright?

dialogues.speaker: EDITH GREENSLY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm fine, I'm just alone, you know? Irving's out with Carmine.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE DIMASO
dialogues.text: That's right, he went out with Carmine and his wife. You must not feel so good about that.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE'S GIRLFRIEND, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: Richard, sit down!

dialogues.speaker: EDITH GREENSLY
dialogues.text: Wait who's there? Who are you with?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE DIMASO
dialogues.text: Oh, no, it's just people.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE'S GIRLFRIEND, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: People? I'm your fiancГ©e! Richard!

dialogues.speaker: EDITH GREENSLY
dialogues.text: Oh, you've got a fiancГ©e. You're engaged.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE DIMASO
dialogues.text: Well, I don't know, no fiancГ©e.    I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: EDITH GREENSLY
dialogues.text: You don't know if you have a fiancГ©e?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE DIMASO
dialogues.text: I don't know --

dialogues.speaker: EDITH GREENSLY
dialogues.text: You don't know? You don't know if you have a fiancГ©e?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE'S MOTHER, (O.S.)
dialogues.text: The fish filter is broken!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't. No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hmm -- intersting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you want to get together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard, do something about the fish tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty-fourth Street?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, fifty-fourth street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what that phone call's about. Everybody thought, "Oh, Richie DiMaso's gonna stay in the office, pushing papers." That's not gonna happen, Mom. I'm outside in the field. I got people working for me. My ideas. I'm running the show. I'm the quarterback. And I'm not gonna settle for no one, Mom. RICHIE KISSES HER ON THE CHEEK AND EXITS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 98   Ext. BARON'S ITALIAN RESTAURANT- CAMDEN- NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: ELLA CARRIES OVER AS --
dialogues.text: SLOW MOTION: Carmine and DOLLY POLITO (big frosted hair) out of his maroon Lincoln Town car. Irv and Rosalyn Rosenfeld get out of his green Cadillac. LOCALS SHOUT TO THE MAYOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ella continues. Mixture of LOCALS: ITALIANS, POLISH, BLAC AND PUERTO RICANS -- wave to the mayor from the bar, and tables, as Irv and Rosalyn follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rocco, you know like we do. The chicken very thin. You should see the way he does this chicken with the red sauce

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right? With the red sauce, the lemon-- Dolly kisses Carmine as he gives his wife's leg a squeeze kisses her cheek, then her mouth. Irv and Rosalyn squeeze hands on the table. SHE KNOCKS BA GLASS OF RED WINE as a plate of Chicken Picatta is served the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the Piccata of the gods! She pulls away awkwardly, waiter refills her glass which throws back right away. Irv looks concerned. They all drink. 101   CUT TO - LATER: Carmine and Irving talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I believe that you should treat people the way that you want to be treated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't Jesus say that or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He may have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Also, always take a favor over money. I think Jesus said that as well. CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) I don't know if he said the second one but he may have said the first one. CUT TO -- Rosalyn DRUNKENLY LEANS IN TALKING TO Dolly POL ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shows her nails) I chip them moving furniture, it's my obsession -- Moving, re- decorating, it makes me feel better like exercise. There's this top coat that you can only get from Switzerland and I don't know what I'm going to do because I'm running out of it but I LOVE the smell of it. DOLLY POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can get that for you, of course. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something, the topcoat, (sniffs nails) it's like perfumey but there's also something rotten? I know that sounds crazy, but I can't get enough of it. Dolly laughs. ROSALYN ROSENFELD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, smell it. It's true. Dolly, historically the best perfumes in the world, they're all laced with something nasty and foul. It's true! She puts it under Irv's nose as he talks to Carmine, he sniffs, closes his eyes, nods without even looking. ROSALYN ROSENFELD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irving loves them. He can't get enough of them. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't get enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hand out to Carmine) Carmine, sweet and sour. Rotten and delicious. She leans across the table and puts them under Carmine's nose. CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smells like flowers. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flowers, but with garbage. CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what that is for me? It's coriander for me. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irving loves it. He can't get enough. That's what hooks you. He always comes back for it. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't stop. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confidentially to Dolly) He's gonna say we have to talk business in five, four, three, two, one -- IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to girls) Dolly, can me and the mayor talk business here? ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (falling off her seat)

dialogues.speaker: AHH-HA-HAHAAAAAAAAHHHHH
dialogues.text: Carmine and Dolly rush to grab Rosalyn; JULIUS, Carmine's steadfast AIDE, BLACK, 40, BIG SIDEBURNS, LOOSENED TIE an white shirtsleeves, BIG SMILE, helps. ROSALYN ROSENFELD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, don't do that it makes me look more drunk than I am! I'm not this drunk. Irving please don't make me go, I was just starting to have fun! She WOBBLES INTO ARMS OF his WIFE Dolly, she and Carmine guide Rosalyn out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Todd Rundgren's "I Saw the Light" plays somewhere. Edith dressed in tight Halston dress, hair flows huge all round her; walks with Richie, who is waiting in a white gray su with a white disco collar outside the lapel, chains aroun his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't your fiance want to come out tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, no, I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, we don't have to talk about it. I was just teasing you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you ever think, how did I end up here? How did my life become this? You ever think that? And you wonder, am I ever gonna get to a better place or is this it? You ever feel like that? Edith stares, nods yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. I definitely know that. Edith nods puts a hand on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry we don't have to go dancing. We can go have coffee or talk or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I need this. Please, I need to go dancing with you. Richie reaches down and squeezes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. 103   Edith smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK baby, let's go dancing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richie and Edith DANCE AND DANCE AND SWEAT to Donna Summe "I Feel Love" -- dance -- riding a high. Edith EXCUSES HERSELF to go to bathroom -- breaks away through crowd -- leaves Richie on dance floor -- then

dialogues.speaker: ARCHES HER BACK --
dialogues.text: SUDDENLY RICHIE STOPS, throws himself back against the ot stall wall, out of breath. Edith LOOKS OVER HER SHOULDER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really fucking like you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like you too. I want to live, alright. For real. No more fake shit. Alright? She get's real close to his face, almost about to kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're going to wait until we decide to go for love Richie. For real. That's when we fuck. Not till then, ok?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you gonna fuck for real or get out of the stall for real?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more fake shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more fake shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more fake shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck me I gotta piss! The girl outside the stall bangs on the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She holds his mouth in one hand and leans in and kisses h they get lost --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out! SHE SHOVES HIM OUT OF THE STALL, LOCKS IT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (outside stall)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to be fucking real!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irv and Carmine JOYOUSLY SING Tom Jones' "Delilah" WITH a RAUNCHOUSLY HAPPY GROUP OF locals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carmine puts down glass of bourbon as he addresses everyo emotionally as he looks at Irving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Julius)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy right here, Irving Rosenfeld? You know what he's gonna do? He's gonna bring the Sheik to Atlantic City, where we can rebuild all those resorts there, put everybody back to work. Irving stares and is moved by this. Tears come to his eye he feels bad about it all suddenly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gonna get this community -- he's gonna get this state -- back on its feet where it belongs. Isn't that right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's gonna grow our tax base and create thousands and thousands of jobs for everyone. You understand that? You know what that means?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Irving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To Irving! Carmine sits down on the couch next to Irving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This guy right here. He's got a big heart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (quietly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd just hate it if it didn't work out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? Of course it's going to work out. Guys like you and me? We dream and we build. We never give up. We never quit.

dialogues.speaker: QUIET
dialogues.text: Irv and Carmine eat breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask you a question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is the sheik black? Irving looks flummoxed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's an Arab. They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's black, isn't it? Irv isn't sure what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you asking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's a dumb question, but I was just wondering -- I would like to arrange for the Sheik to see Camden. To see the people of Camden. The people I serve. The people I love. Who are mostly black and Puerto Rican. I really want him to see how good this is going to be for the community, how ready we are for this opportunity, and he can see how far his dollar will go. You know what I mean? What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah we can do that. He can see Camden.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relieved)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I got something I wanna give to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got you a gift. Let's get out of here. The girls are going to kill us I'm sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk in the morning sun to Carmine's Lincoln where h opens the trunk and they stare at what is inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a microwave. It heats up everything. Pasta, lasagna, meatballs, whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's science, yeah. That's how it heats up the food. It's scientific.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you specifically bought this science oven for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Carmine stares meaningfully at Irv)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. A new friend. Irv is touched. He sees it is a sincere gift from Carmine because Carmine likes him; not cynical in any way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't put metal in it. Come on, let's get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a jet at Teeterboro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a jet at Teeterboro for the sheik.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't need a jet. Let him walk to the curb at JFK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stoddard, that's not how it works. You got to do it from the feet up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That doesn't mean anything. What's that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It means you gotta be committed! It means you gotta be committed to something in your life, for Christ's sake. I want a jet at Teterboro for the Sheik. It can be a small jet. It doesn't even have to take off, cause I know you're so worried about how much money the Bureau's gonna fucking spend. It can take off and land on the tarmac, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, you can have a jet for an hour, but it takes off and lands at Teterboro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got the jet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got the jet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 110             Thank you. Richie goes to walk out of Stoddard's office but stops at door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So tell me the rest of the ice fishing story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where was I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your father woke you up, it was a blizzard, it was Lake Canoga. Come on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, well, my brother and I were on the ice and my father came out of the house and I could see him coming. He was holding a lantern, and it was in the blizzard and I knew he was gonna be angry. So I went to intercept my father because I knew if he saw what my brother was doing he was going to kill him. Richie cuts him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you tried to protect your brother, but you couldn't and that's why you feel bad, because you're trying to protect me and you're worried about me. Is that what the story's about? About protection?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's not about protection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not about protection?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, fine. Richie walks out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ros talks to herself carrying tin foil covered tray of lasagna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Don't put metal in the science oven, don't put metal in the science oven, Rosalyn"...always treats me like a fucking child. I'll do whatever I want. She puts the tin foil lasagna into microwave. After a few moments it sparks, explodes into flames. DANNY RUNS IN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANNY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (runs in) Another fire! ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grabbing a fire extinguisher) No, Danny, not that one! That one's empty! We gotta use the big one!

dialogues.speaker: SMASH TO
dialogues.text: IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you not to put metal in the science oven. Why did you do that for? ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't make such a big deal. Just get another one. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want another one. I want the one that Carmine gave me. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "I want the one Carmine gave me!" Carmine, Carmine, why don't you just marry Carmine, get a little gold microwave and put it on a chain around your neck. You want to be more like Carmine? Why don't you build something like he does, instead of all your empty deals that are just like your fucking science oven. You know I read that it takes all of the nutrition out of our food. It's empty, just like your deals. Empty, empty! IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's bullshit. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not bullshit. I read it in an article. Look, by Paul Brodeur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring something into this house that's gonna take all the nutrition out of our food and then light our house on fire? Thank God for me. Ros stares defiantly, clicks her nails on the counter. PR LAP JET ROAR, IRVING STARES AT ROS and BURNED OVEN and lo at the magazine article.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JET ROAR LANDING. A small airport. Irv stands alone, star at Edith and Richie kissing. Richie, in long full length fleece lined suede coat, walks over towards where Carmine stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you should come to Carmine's party tonight. You look beautiful by the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look at me. Don't look at my legs, don't look at my hair, don't smell my hair, don't ask me how I am, don't talk to me outside of these roles, 'cause we're done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Get under the umbrella. It's just that Carmine wants Rosalyn to come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care. You weren't listening. I don't care if Rosalyn comes. Just do your job, okay? You're nothing to me until you're everything. I'm not Rosalyn. I'm not gonna put up with that shit. THEY ARRIVE AT Richie as the JET arrives on the tarmac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that's a fucking jet right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's good. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the kinda moves you need to make. They walk towards the Jet and walk on leaving Carmine and Edith waiting outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irv and Richie step aboard to find FBI AGENT PACO HERNAND putting on a regal looking white Arab keffyeh headdress a robe -- he looks noble. TWO AGENTS posing as body guards. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paco, Richie Dimaso, good to meet you in person [shakes Paco's hand] - this is Irving Rosenfeld. Irv nods to Paco and the other agents. PACO HERNANDEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paco Hernandez. Nice to meet you. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paco? He's--wait, he's not a real Arab. PACO HERNANDEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. I'm Mexican. From Tuscon. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, where's my guy? Where's Al from Queens? RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who? IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My friend from Queens. Where is he? What are you doing? RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta hire an F.B.I. guy. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you-- (to Paco) You speak any Arabic? PACO HERNANDEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   Abdullah Ahmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it? That's all you got? PACO HERNANDEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I have a couple phrases. Irving isn't sure, looks Paco up and down. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Richie) From the feet up, you motherfucker. What are you doing? (to Paco) Act normal. That's it. Like you can barely understand English. You can't speak it. You say as little as possible. You follow my lead. Alright? PACO HERNANDEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Richie) Who's running this?    I thought you were running it. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am running this but you've gotta listen to him. He's the guy with the vision. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got the vision? You know what vision I had? You just kissing my girl outside. That's what vision I had. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stares at Irving) I thought you guys broke up. I'm giving you a compliment. PACO HERNANDEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on? RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it. Irving takes a expensive looking ceremonial knife out of jacket pocket and holds it out to Paco. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a knife. This is for the Mayor. You've got to present it to him. Look me in the eye. This means a lot to you. Right? That knife. PACO HERNANDEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Play it. You present it. "Friendship for life," alright? You gotta feel it. Sacred. Can you do it? PACO HERNANDEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Sacred. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta sell it. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sell it. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you believe it's sacred, it's sacred. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to what he's saying. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you do it? RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the details. That's what makes this guy a genius. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again? You compliment me again. What is this, rubbing salt in the wound? Irving stares incredulously. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm complimenting you. (to Paco) Any other questions? PACO HERNANDEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I think the name of this operation is offensive. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? PACO HERNANDEZ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Abscam. "Arab Scam?" It's racist. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you fucking kidding? What do you care? You're Mexican.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELO's "10538 Overture" kicks on. Irv and Richie exit the plane walking slightly behind the "sheik" and his "bodyguards" - the sheik in the front. The Sheik hands the ceremonial knife to Carmine and bows head --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Sheik, my friend. Welcome. On behalf of the great state of New Jersey I want to welcome you to New Jersey. I know that was redundant. I'm sorry. I'm just very nervous. 116   Carmine takes the knife and looks to the others exc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to "shiek") We have a great party planned for you this evening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (half dressed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what are you talking about, I can't go? I just did my hair and makeup and everything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheik's very particular. It's international cultural protocol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: International protocol? What the fuck are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not answer that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (answers phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello -- Robert Spencer? I don't know a Robert Spencer. What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (takes phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give it to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is that? IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the phone) Look, I told you, for God's sake, I told you not to call here. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that about? RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) Two more federal agents tonight,

dialogues.speaker: OK
dialogues.text: Ros leaves the room. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. They're bodyguards for the Sheik. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's too many people for me to control, no. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look. I'm in charge here, alright? Just do it. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosalyn, get off the extension!

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL ROSALYN IN KITCHEN LISTENING ON THE PHONE.
dialogues.text: ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hangs up) I'm not on it! But she was on it. She heard. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, don't call here again, alright? Don't call at home. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: OK.
dialogues.text: RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good night. He HANGS UP and walks into the kitchen. Rosalyn looks at ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Federal agents? IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's bodyguards for the visiting dignitary, that's all. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, an I.R.S. thing?     Like a tax investigation? IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why you gotta say that? I mean, that's why I can't invite you. It's too complicated. Listen, come on. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you in trouble? IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, stop being so nosy. Irving opens the fridge which is a mess. IRVING ROSENFELD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this shit. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm only nosy cause you never tell me anything. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we clean up this fridge? I mean, what are you causing trouble for all the time? PHONE RINGS AGAIN. IRVING ROSENFELD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: DO NOT ANSWER THAT--
dialogues.text: ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picks up phone) HEL-LO- Oh, hi, Carmine. We were just talking about you. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROSALYN ROSENFELD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irving's being a mean, boring man saying that he doesn't want me to come tonight. CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone)Tell him he's crazy! ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I agree. Want to tell him yourself? IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme the phone, come on. CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wouldn't be a party without you! ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you imagine? Tell him yourself. She hands the phone to a very exasperated, anxious, Irv. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into telephone) Hey, Carmie. CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irving, you're crazy! Your wife is coming, you kidding me? She's the life of the party! Everybody loves her. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the life of the party! IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confidential into phone) Look, you know what she's like. She's unpredictable. She's just always -- ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, don't talk about me like that! What's Carmine saying? IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't hear what he's saying. CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Irving, it's very important that she come, you understand? ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carmine loves me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) This is a really big night for us, you understand? Come on, you gotta bring your wife. And Dolly's got somethin' special for her. Dolly is getting dressed for the party in the background. DOLLY POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her I got the nail polish for her. CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? Listen! DOLLY POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (raising her voice to phone) I got your nail polish for you, sweetie! CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see? Somethin' special for you. What is it? Tell me. I mean, (lowers his voice, conspiratorial) What is it, you got a girlfriend coming? Come on, I thought we were friends. You're not gonna tell me you got a girlfriend? This is ridiculous. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's just Rosalyn's unpredictable. CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, we're gonna handle this like men, you understand? You're bringing your wife. We're gonna have a good time. That's an order from the Mayor. Good-bye. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Rosalyn) Alright, you happy? Go get ready. Irv hangs up and exits the kitchen. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I am happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elton John's "Goodbye Yellow Brick Road" plays on the soundtrack as Irv drives: tinted glasses, large comb over blue crushed velvet suit, dark tie -- PAN TO: VISOR MIRROR -- WHERE Rosalyn APPLIES MASCARA --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elton John continues as Carmine LIGHTS A CIGARETTE in a t toned GRAY AND BLACK TUXEDO, at the center of a haphazard carpet situation in front of a has-been beach resort -- l old movie premiere spotlights rotate onto the facade in a assorted CROWD OF LOCALS some dressed up - JULIUS, CARMINE, TITO, MELORA (Carmine's STEADFAST AIDES) son DOMINIC, daughter LUCILLE, wife Dolly, assorted COPS, FIREMEN IN FORMAL UNIFORMS WHITE GLOVES, UNION GUYS in su fringe the area. Carmine 's family is dressed up.

dialogues.speaker: SHRIEKS IN ECSTACY.
dialogues.text: Greets everyone.

dialogues.speaker: JAMS WITH GRINDING SOUND, LAMP EXPLODES IN SMOKE --
dialogues.text: THROUGH THE SMOKE FROM THE FIRE STEPS: Richie IN A WHITE SUIT, Edith stunning SILVER METALLIC Halston dress, WHITE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Edith, glaring) I know who you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irv tries to turn Rosalyn away, but she keeps turning bac giving Edith the hairy eyeball, as Edith gives it right b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who that is Irving. Off to the side, Richie steels himself with bump of cocai before walking inside the old resort, his eyes dilate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entourage walks through the ornate lobby as Edith and Rosalyn continue to eyeball each other with Irv uncomfort in the middle as Carmine ENTHUSIASTICALLY CONTINUES HIS PRESENTATION FOR THE SHEIK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this is the lobby. Now mind you, a week ago this place was a mess, but what existed was this plasterwork. Look at the detail. This is beautiful. My sons are craftsmen. (to son, Dominic) Please, tell them what you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them everything you know. The trompe l'oeil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Birds, sky, clouds, wood. Trompe l'oeil -- "Trick of the eye."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can restore all of this, you see? You save 50 million -- look at me -- fifty million right off the bat -- I waive the law I helped write. It said casino construction must be ground up new, we don't do new. We renovate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't do new. We renovate. Carmine leads all of them through the very crowded lobby he talks. Irving listens intently, moved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 200 PEOPLE ARE GATHERED around blackjack, roulette, and c tables, playing and having a good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We put in some temporary fun -- some gaming tables, some play money for people to have a good time. For charity -- the Boys and Girls Club and some arts programs. Rosalyn walking with Irving, continues to stare daggers a Edith, who stays close to Richie. Carmine, Julius, Melora, CONTINUE TO LEAD EVERYONE INTO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carmine continues to walk --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the Ocean Room -- He pushes open double upholstered old doors --

dialogues.speaker: THEY ENTER THE LARGE CROWDED YET INTIMATE BEMELMANS STYLE
dialogues.text: The bar -- LIKE THE BEMELMANS BAR AT THE CARLYLE HOTEL IN

dialogues.speaker: ANOTHER SMALLER BAR ON THE FAR SIDE OF THE ROOM ---
dialogues.text: Carmine pauses to stare at the MEN AT THE FAR BAR -- FIVE IN SUITS, 40 TO 60, SLIGHTLY MOB-LOOKING. AS Irv IS PULLED ASIDE CONFIDENTIALLY BY Carmine -- Richi AND Edith WATCH -- Rosalyn STANDS TO THE SIDE -- Carmine puts his arm around Irv's shoulders --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are some gentlemen over there at the bar. That's a hundred and thirty years sitting there -- that's how much time's between them. They run the biggest casinos in the United States. We have to work with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The good news is they know how it's done. They get it done. You don't have to worry. Everyone makes their money. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean the Mob? CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but they're businessmen, okay? Now, spend as much or as little time with them as you like, but we do have to deal with them. All we've got to do is go say hello. We just gotta say hi, that's all. Edith looks on, calm, as Richie -- WILD EYED WITH COCAINE

dialogues.speaker: ADRENALINE --
dialogues.text: IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carmine, maybe -- I'm not sure that's such a good idea. We gotta confer before we talk to these guys. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (interrupting, hopped up) Confer? What is there to confer about? They're casino guys. CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are businessmen. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We came all this way, Irving. We should be here. What's everybody scared of? There's nothing to be scared of. Richie stares down Irv, Edith pulls Richie back -- Rosaly starting to go down a SPIRAL OF DEPRESSION as she looks increasingly uncomfortable. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: the mob guys) Those are the guys you're all scared of? Those guys over there? They don't scare me. She glares at Edith and Irv and pivots to walk to the bar IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosalyn!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she's already on her way over to the MAFIA MEN at the who GREET HER WARMLY as Irv, Edith, Richie, and Carmine watch. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love this! Rosalyn walks up to PETE MUSANE, CHARISMATIC, 30 and sits down in between all the Mafia guys.. THE OTHER THREE SALT PEPPER MAFIA GUYS LAUGH AND TALK WITH Rosalyn - who gulps glass of PROSECCO and IS REFILLED BY PETE MUSANE. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.   Can I sit here? Carmine whispers to Irv as he watches Rosalyn talk to the Mafia guys. CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irving, this is not a good idea. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you guys doing? Everybody over there is really scared of you guys, you know that? She knocks back the prosecco. She seems relieved. Dolly ushers her kids to the door. DOLLY POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids, I want you to go up and get some pizza and soda, please. Irving and Edith watch in horror at Rosalyn. EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a disaster. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think they have this room all wrong. PETE MUSANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? What would you do? ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would do it in all black and gold and I would do this bar like a big, warm golden mirror. DICK HELSING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Rosalyn's smitten by the mobsters. PETE MUSANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you expect that from her because she's so beautiful -- ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh stop. DICK HELSING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gorgeous. PETE MUSANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love her hair, so I know I'm gonna love how she'd do the room -- He touches the front of her huge Farrah overhang bangs. Richie, Irving, Carmine, and the Sheik walk up to them. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you do? PETE MUSANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Richie) I'm sorry is she your wife? IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, she's my wife. She's my wife. CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at these fine gentleman. PETE MUSANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carmine, there you are. CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing? Irving takes the glass of prosecco out of Rosalyn's hand puts it on table. PETE MUSANE AND GUYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhhh, heyyyyy! Come onnn! ROSALYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's because he's a party pooper. He's so boring. Irving stares fuming at Rosalyn and the guys, he nods and forces a smile good naturedly as they put prosecco glass his hand. He knows how to fake it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETE MUSANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a very beautiful wife. DICK HELSING, ROSALYN ROSENFELD, OTHER GUYS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Salud.

dialogues.speaker: STARE WITH TENSION.
dialogues.text: THEY ALL LAUGH. RICHIE GUIDES SHEIK with ONE BODY GUARD. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I present Sheik Abdullah, gentlemen, from Abu Dhabi. Sheik, these men are professionals, they run the best casinos in the United States. The Sheik acknowledges them with a nod. Irv is extremely uncomfortable. PETE MUSANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Sheik, as a sign of our seriousness, Mr. Tallegio came from Miami to meet you tonight. HEAVY PAUSE. CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Tallegio? Why didn't you tell me Mr. Tallegio was here? PETE MUSANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in the back room. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a sign of disrespect to do business on the first meeting. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not true. I don't know what your talking about. (to Musane) He's got it all wrong. DICK HELSING

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, don't leave him back there in the back room waiting. Come on, let's go. Rosalyn reaches to have her glass refilled by Dick Helsin when one of the other guys NUDGES her hip in her tight dr and she drops into Pete Musane's lap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Irving, I'm going to be having fun. Maybe it will be contagious. Irving turns and heads with dread towards the back door w Carmine, Richie, and the Sheik. Sydney, worried about Ros with Musane, decides to hang back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carmine!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor Tellegio was from Miami. He was Meyer Lansky's right-hand man. In his prior reputation as an enforcer from twenty years ago, he was known to never bury a body because he felt it sent a stronger message to leave it in the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the guy we now had to deal with.

dialogues.speaker: RESUME PUSH IN ON TELLEGIO AS A COUPLE OF BUSBOYS SET UP
dialogues.text: IMPROMPTU TABLE AND CHAIRS. Carmine greets him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you don't want to go into the Ocean Bar? It's really, it's beautiful in there. VICTOR   TELLEGIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm very happy I   don't have to go there. I like it   here. There's an exit. I'm like a   ghost. Nobody knows I'm here. Busboys whip open a white table cloth for the table. Everyone sits down. Tellegio looks at the Sheik, then ove Richie. VICTOR TELLEGIO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell him I speak for our friends in Florida. We're very excited. It's been our lifelong dream to build casino resorts on the East Coast. Richie pretends to translate in the Sheik's ear. VICTOR TELLEGIO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told him that? They didn't want the Jews to make money, they didn't want the Italians to make money, definitely don't want the blacks to make money. After the oil embargo -- the gasoline crisis -- the hijackings, the Olympics, they don't want to see Arabs make money, trust me, not on our soil. You can tell him this in your own way: I've been in the casino business forty years. It's scrutinized more carefully than any other business. Carmine made this legal, but we must be careful or they'll take it away. CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Mister Tellegio, how do you think we should approach this? What do you want to do? VICTOR TELLEGIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want to get the gaming license and keep it we have to make our principal investor here, the Sheik, an American citizen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irving and Richie both look at Victor intensely not sure where this is going. CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To expedite citizenship -- well, that requires very special treatment. VICTOR TELLEGIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You would know the right people to do that, Carmine. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carmine knows everybody. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we talking about? CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: U.S. Senators. Congressmen. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, that's fantastic. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say stay away from that. That's bad. That's trouble. No, that's not good. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irving please. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's trouble. VICTOR TELLEGIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this guy? (to Irving) What are you, a farmer? Richie and Tellegio both laugh. CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Tellegio, I'm sorry, this is Irving. New York businessman. Irving Rosenfeld. VICTOR TELLEGIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irving, Irving. What's the matter, Irving? What's the problem? IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing. No problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VICTOR TELLEGIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get your balls in an uproar. Everything's fine, everything's good. It's all good. It's all good. I just hope the other part of this is all good. And real. Because we're real. You know that. You deal with us. We're a real organization. We deal with you, we don't know what we're dealing with. Everyone stares increasingly tense at Tellegio in silence This could go wrong at any minute. Tellegio looks over to Richie and points to the Sheik. Irving watches in horror as -- VICTOR TALLEGIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's he from? RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (winging it) Abu Dhabi. VICTOR TELLEGIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he's from the Emirates. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. VICTOR TELLEGIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in subtitled Arabic) (Can I count on you? You gotta be honest about this. Do you understand me? Good means good. No bullshit.) PUSH IN ON IRV AND CARMINE FEELING THIS IMMENSE PRESSURE.

dialogues.speaker: WHAT THE FUCK IS GOING ON HERE
dialogues.text: VICTOR TELLEGIO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sheik) (Did you hear what I said? Do you want me to repeat it?) Irving looks ill, as does everyone else at the table. VICTOR TELLEGIO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (What do you think now? Tell me. Tell me.) RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh, I think, I think what he's --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VICTOR TELLEGIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, let him speak for himself. Sheik swallows hard and looks to Richie. It's a very tens moment for everyone at the table. Tellegio stares. Everyone hangs on this. Irving and Richi share a look -- what is he doing? A DRUNK, AL KOWALSKI, a working man, friend of the Mayor BARRELS INTO INTO THE TABLE, spilling drinks. Tellegio's jump in and grab him and start to pull him away. CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I know him. AL KOWALSKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys are way too serious for a party!(to Tellegio) Hey, what are you drinking? You got a drink? TELLEGIO GLARES BACK AT THE INTRUSION. CARMINE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Al) We're in a very serious meeting. (to Tellegio) I apologize. TELLEGIO DOES NOT LOOK AMUSED. AL KALOWSKI

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand, you're in conference. You gotta come with me now. You got a speech to give. Everyone's waiting for you. CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Al, I'll be right behind you, okay? Trust me. Paco Hernandez/Sheik stands up and reaches over to Telleg to shake his hand. Irving panics. THE MENACING DEEP BASS INTRO OF "WHITE RABBIT" FADES UP ON THE SOUNDTRACK. SHEIK ABDULLAH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Arabic) It is great doing business with you. The investment is real. It was a pleasure to meet you. Irving exhales in relief that Paco managed to say anythin passable in Arabic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IRVING ROSENFELD (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are the odds of an Italian guy from Miami knowing Arabic? But it turns out he's got casino investments in the Mideast and he spent two years learning it to keep the upper hand. Victor leans over to talk to Carmine. VICTOR TELLEGIO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me carefully. If you're real, you put ten million in the bank of our choice in the next two weeks. Carmine nods. VICTOR TELLEGIO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carmine, listen to me carefully, if you're real, you put ten million in the bank of our choice in the next two weeks or not only will the Sheik feel insulted, but our friends in Florida will feel deeply disrespected and so will I. Irving looks at Victor, who stares back at him. This is b

dialogues.speaker: TO HER.
dialogues.text: EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosalyn, you need to come with me alright? ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need to come with you. EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You need to come with me. This needs to stop. Come on. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you think I should come with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you need to come with me right now. Rosalyn takes her wrist out of Sydney's grasp. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you get your fucking hands off me, you fucking whore! PETE MUSANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a whore. (to everyone) This is my husband's whore! EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's real nice. DOLLY POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not going to do this in the Ocean Room tonight. Not tonight. Please. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my husbands whore! Dolly escorts Edith over to one side of the room away fro Rosalyn. DOLLY POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stay over here with me. Everybody just calm down. I don't know what's going on. Pete looks over to Rosalyn. PETE MUSANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You alright? Take it easy. These things happen. Whatever's meant to be will be. Rosalyn smiles at Pete. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I always say. PETE MUSANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You say that? ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? Kindred spirits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever's meant to be will be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever's meant to be will be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosalyn looks in mirror: sadness, anger, fear. Edith rush in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell do you think you're doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell do I think I'm doing?! What the fuck do you think you're doing? You really gonna come in here and judge me for flirting with somebody after you've been fucking my husband for how many years?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have any fucking clue what's going on! Rosalyn holds her hand, with wedding ring to Sydney's fac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a ring on my finger. We have a child together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't love you Rosalyn he loves me. And you know it and I know it and he knows it. And it might be done now, but it was beautiful and it was real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop. EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we loved each other. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. Rosalyn starts to tear up. EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You scare him, and you manipulate him, and you use your son! ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, he must like it on some level. He must want it because he keeps coming back for it. It's like that perfume that you love that you can't stop smelling, even when there's something sour in it. You can't get enough of it. But guess what, he's never gonna leave me. He's always going to want me, and I will make you so sorry, Edith. I will make you so sorry for what you've done to my family, mark my words. EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is fucked up! I would never say anything that fucked up to anybody, but you do because you're gross inside, you're so fucked up and gross. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm gross inside? EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you're gross inside, with robbing people and all that shit that you do? Maybe we're both gross inside, that's what Irving loves about us. At least he's consistent with his women. You know, sometimes in life all you have are fucked up, poisonous choices. Rosalyn reaches over, grabs Sydney's face and kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosalyn laughs a toxic, tough front dark laugh and walks THE BEE GEES "HOW CAN YOU MEND A BROKEN HEART?" STARTS. Sydney looks into the mirror and wipes the lipstick off h lips as Rosalyn storms out of the powder room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need to talk! This is serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen, your friend, the working man's friend, my friend, Mayor Carmine Polito! ON STAGE: Carmine TAKES MIC Irving stands off to the side of the stage as his world closes in around him. Pulls his heart pills out of his po and takes one. Sydney sees this as she stands nearby with Richie. Irv, Edith, Richie watch near stage, jostled. Rosalyn ent the ball room looking disheveled as she is guided by Pete Musane looks to stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on mic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Camden! Hello, New Jersey! Hello, Atlantic City! [CROWD ROARS] A lot of my friends been out of work [CROWD WHISTLES - BOOS] A lot of good hard working families just wanna WORK AND LIVE. (crowd CHEERS) There's no money nowhere. You gotta be kidding me! -- don't they remember who built this country? [CHEERS] The one thing we can all agree about in the State of New Jersey is that we never, ever give up! Do we? Carmine dominates the crowd and you can see the emotion i his face as he says this. He raises his glass to the crow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, raise a glass with me to a new era that begins tonight. From me and my family, we thank you. For all the hard work that you've given us in the community. Look what you've done. This is beautiful! Thank you! Crowd ROARS WILDLY. Irv watches, MOVED AND DESTROYED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irving walks in with his keys, same clothes from night before, as ocean sounds continue, TAKES A GUN FROM THE SA and he stands looking lost and lonely, he turns on the electric dry cleaning rack, where he and SYDNEY STOOD TOGETHER, IN LOVE. He looks heartsick. HE STEPS INSIDE TH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG BANG BANG -- Richie POUNDS ON SYDNEY'S DOOR -- SYDNE HAIR IN CURLERS, ANSWERS THE DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I use your phone?

dialogues.speaker: INT. SYDNEY'S APARTMENT DAY
dialogues.text: intense, phone in hand, SHIRT SLEEVES, a mess. HE DIALS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Sydney)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night was insane. I got it all figured out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stoddard Thorsen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I need the Sherman Suite at the Plaza Hotel, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a whole floor of the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need a whole floor. I need it for my operation

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) Stop calling it your operation, Richard. It's not your operation. And I'm not giving you a whole floor of the Plaza Hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have members of Congress that are gonna come in right now to try to give the Sheik citizenship. They're taking bribes. This is happening right now. That's what's happening right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STODDARD THORSEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) Bribing members of Congress are you out of your fucking mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stoddard. Stoddard! Shut up! Listen! Do you know who Victor Tellegio is? Victor. Tellegio. Works for Meyer Lansky. You know who that is? STODDARD THORSEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know who Victor Tellegio is. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Resorts International! He wants ten million dollars. I have two weeks! STODDARD THORSEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not getting ten million dollars. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Just listen to me! You're not listening to me! I have two weeks! I have two weeks to put this thing together and I need you to get me the Sherman Suite at the Plaza Hotel. And your going to fucking do it! STODDARD THORSEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lower your voice. You don't get to yell at me. Richie SLAMS DOWN THE PHONE. Edith (HAIR IN CURLERS) STAR AT HIM. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Calm me down baby. You gotta calm me down. He handles her hips and neck and waist and ass. RICHIE DIMASO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby let's do this. Let's do this right now. --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to do this. You're fucking skin is glowing baby. Your skin is glowing. EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not doing this with you. We're not going to do this unless we do it for real, alright? RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to do this now! EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what we agreed on so we're not going to do that alright? Alright? Where are you? You're acting all scary. She grabs him by the head to calm him down. EDITH GREENSLY (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you here with me? HE TRIES A GENTLER SEDUCTION. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (leans down to her eyes) I love you. I love you. Look at me. (slowly) I'm in love with you. It is real now. I just said it so now's the time. He handles her, nuzzles her neck, starts to turn her on. EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kissing him) You want the truth? You want real? RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ready for real.

dialogues.speaker: SOMETHING CLICKS INSIDE HER
dialogues.text: SYDNEY PROSSER (DROPS HER BRITISH ACCENT)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK, this is real. Do you hear my voice? This is real. This is real. What you hear is real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richie steps back quickly and grabs Sydney. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is me. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? What are you doing an accent? An American accent? EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. There is no English. There's only American. There is no English. Richie looks at her and continues to hold her looking ver confused and flustered. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? Stop it. You're Edith. You're Edith Greensly. I checked your records. SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I falsified my records back to birth. I falsified them. SYDNEY PROSSER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Sydney Prosser, and I'm from Albuquerque, New Mexico. I'm not Edith Greensly. There is no Edith Greensly. Richie steps back. He stares at her darkly. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're -- freaking -- me -- out. No, you said in the stall that we were going to be real and that we weren't going to fake it. SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm being real now. This is who I am. I'm Sydney Prosser. Ok? RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So -- why -- did you do an English accent after that? SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I didn't tell you in the stall. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SYDNEY PROSSER (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I created Edith because I needed her to survive, okay? But I'm done with that now. I'm so fucking done with that. Like you do what you need to survive, right? You do it. You know, you live with your mom -- you have a fiancГ©e you don't even acknowledge, right? That's what you do. And you curl your hair in little fucking curlers, which is -- No, it's okay, you look good with it, but you know -- you have straight hair, so that's what you do to survive. You do all sorts of things, you know. We all do. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers tensely) Please don't talk about that. I'm confused. I'm confused and -- SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm fucking confused too, alright? RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- I think we should fuck, and then we'll feel it and we won't be confused anymore.

dialogues.speaker: HE EMBRACES HER --
dialogues.text: SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No -- I want to talk. I don't want to fuck. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (embracing her) Yes! Come on. SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NO! I'm not fucking you. I'm not fucking fucking you! RED FACED LIKE HE MAY HIT HER, a vein stands out in his n SHE FLINCHES. HE SCREAMS like an animal in confusion and frustration. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richie in pain holds his cut forehead and eyebrow. RICHIE DIMASO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in pain and dismay)

dialogues.speaker: SHIT
dialogues.text: They hear a door open off screen, someone approaches. Irv appears from around the corner of the wall pointing his handgun at Richie. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you please step away from Edith. I'm asking you nicely please step away from Edith right now. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck -- IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step away from her. Please. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean Sydney? Irving looks over to Sydney very confused. SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told him. I'm sorry. I just don't give a fuck anymore, I don't give a fuck. I don't fucking care. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irving has a gun. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What Richie's gotten us into is worse then jail. I told you last night, don't sit down with those goons. And what? Now what? No one's getting ten million for Tellegio. It's over. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so. Irving and Sydney stare. RICHIE DIMASO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly) Because when Tellegio finds out what happened, do you think he's gonna go after me? I don't think so. Someone from the Bureau? (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHIE DIMASO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think he's gonna go after a politician? He's gonna kill you. Then he's going to go after your son. And Sydney. Richie PICKS UP PHONE AS THEY WATCH -- HE DIALS. INTERCUT STODDARD THORSEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) Stoddard Thorsen. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly, intensely) You're going to give me the Sherman Suite. The whole floor. HIS NOSE AND FOREHEAD ARE CUT FROM THE GLASS. STODDARD THORSEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a NO. I said no wacko. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're going to tell me the point of that FUCKING fishing story. STODDARD THORSEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the way you're behaving. RICHIE DIMASO (FUMING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter with you? Where are you right now? STODDARD THORSEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does that make a difference? RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell me where the fuck you are. STODDARD THORSEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The field office on 61st street. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm coming to 61st Street. Right now. STODDARD THORSEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to do what? RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To beat -- your ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to what? Richie SLAMS the phone down, storms out the apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were right. We should have gone away. Irving sits in the corner of the room a disheveled mess. Sydney sits on the bed drinking a Fresca.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should have gone away with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were supposed to do it from the feet up like you always said. That's how we were meant to do it but you didn't do it like that. You didn't do it like that. You played it safe so there was always a danger you were going to end up with Rosalyn in the dead space, floating on some dead spaceship with the furniture and the curtains. And I was your life line out and you were mine and that was ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Irving stares at her, emotional)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could get you back. He walks across the room and sits down on the bed next to Sydney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I can't do it without you. You know that. Come on. Me, you and Danny. Like we said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I said. You never said that. I said that. We gotta get over on all these guys. That's what we need to be thinking about right now. Irving takes off his glasses and rubs his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's big. That's crazy. Whatever it is, it's got to be the best we've ever done. Sydney nods her head yes, stares intensely at Irving as t camera tilts down to reveal: their hands clasped together

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High ceiling, old office. Close on a tape recorder.

dialogues.speaker: FACE AND A WHITE EYE PATCH ON HIS INJURED EYE, SITTING
dialogues.text: OPPOSITE PROSECUTOR, AMADO   - - the tape recorder and microphone sit on the desk   in front of Stoddard as he r a statement for a report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SLOW MIDWEST MONOTONE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent Dimaso called me late at night on the 21st. I believe that he was intoxicated. He threatened me and I told him this was inappropriate. I told him procedures exist for reasons we must respect. This is the third such call I received from Agent Dimaso. He called me again the night of the 5th and he threatened to kill me. Subsequently he demanded that I allow him to use the Sherman Suite at the Plaza hotel for purposes of bribing members of congress. Camera pull-back reveals: THE CHASTENED Richie SITS LISTENING, IN A SUIT AND TIE. He's in trouble with their boss, the prosecutor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not finished. There's a lot more. Richie gets up and pulls up a chair next to Stoddard. Stoddard flinches and moves away like he's going to get h again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have nothing but the utmost respect for you as my mentor. (he reaches down and turns the tape recorder off) and as my --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: the recorder)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to talk from my heart. I don't want it on record. I want to get vulnerable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I finish? Can I finish my statement?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. I respect you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you do other things besides respect me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stoddard paces while on the phone, holds up a finger to Richie to wait, Richie picks up Stoddard's phone -- rips cord out and smashes Stoddard across the face with the ba Doesn't stop til Stoddard falls to the ground, knocks ove desk chair and bookcase behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just hard for me to control my passion. I'm a very passionate person. (looks to Amado) You're from New York. You understand this. He goes ice fishing in the midwest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was told to you in confidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's an ice fishing guy. Look at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where we left off. Stoddard reaches with bloodied hands across -- what is he reaching for? Oh, on a small table, gun and a clip. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing pulling out your gun? Stop it. That's not you. STODDARD THORSEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's me. This is me. It's me. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do something that you don't know anything about. Alright? Richie grabs his gun and starts to load it. STODDARD THORSEN

dialogues.speaker: GUN.
dialogues.text: RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll show you how it's done. I'm not even going to hit you. He points the gun at Stoddard. RICHIE DIMASO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch this fucko.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richie and Stoddard stare at each other in silence. ANTHONY AMADO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you want to use the Sherman Suite? The entire floor? Stoddard throws his head back, looks at ceiling in exasperation.

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE DIMASO
dialogues.text: Yes! At the Plaza Hotel.

dialogues.speaker: ANTHONY AMADO
dialogues.text: What happened to the Mafia? I thought you were --

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE DIMASO
dialogues.text: This is where they intersect! This is where the two things intersect. The Politicians and the Mafia. Victor Tellegio's people who run resorts international --

dialogues.speaker: ANTHONY AMADO
dialogues.text: Victor Tellegio showed his face?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE DIMASO
dialogues.text: Yes. I sat with him. I sat with Victor Tellegio. I hung out with him. We can get him. We can get his whole organization as well as getting any number of congressmen. I mean, that's just peeling the first layer of the onion.

dialogues.speaker: ANTHONY AMADO
dialogues.text: Wow. How you going to do that?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE DIMASO
dialogues.text: We would get ten million dollars and put it into an account --

dialogues.speaker: STODDARD THORSEN
dialogues.text: TEN MILLION DOLLARS?! Ten Million dollars?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE DIMASO
dialogues.text: And that's how we just let them know we're for real.

dialogues.speaker: ANTHONY AMADO
dialogues.text: What does he say he's gonna do for the ten million dollars? How are we trapping him?

dialogues.speaker: RICHIE DIMASO
dialogues.text: He promises to build casinos, handle the skims, do the licencing -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you have him on tape saying this. You have that right? No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Richie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to find a safer way to get Victor Tellegio on a wire. No ten million dollars -- that's crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Richie looks down, defeated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even to entrap Tellegio it's crazy. But you can have the Sherman Suite -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --Stoddard, please -- To go and get me some congressmen. Go get some congressmen taking bribes. I want to pinch us some congressmen, ok? You come back to me. I'm proud of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. (then as an afterthought) And Stoddard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richie and Stoddard walk down large, echoey Federal build corridor. Stoddard walking ten feet ahead turns and point Richie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts bitterly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good luck keeping your job, by the way, and staying out of jail -- and not being killed by the Mob. But other than that you're doing a great job. Stoddard turns and storms off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Stoddard walks away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the end of the ice fishing story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not telling you the end of the ice fishing story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to call your fucking brother and find out from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brother's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how it ends. He fell through the fucking ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts bitterly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No it's not. He died a different way, many years later. He storms off and leaves Richie staring in the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richie walks out of a surveillance room and down the hall to where Irv and Sydney wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen I know it's awkward and I just want to say I'm sorry, alright? I think we can stick together and still fulfill our goal. I mean, we got the Sherman Suite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got the whole floor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
