dialogues.text: We got the whole floor, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you ok? SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. You? Richie gestures to his eye that Sydney smashed with the picture frame. He's got a few little scabs. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright. I got hit a little bit. My eye. It's a little blurry but I got drops at the pharmacy. Richie looks over to Irving. RICHIE DIMASO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you OK? IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I'm good -- Richie looks back over to Sydney RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I'm sorry. SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Irving) I'm sorry Irving. Irving doesn't know what to say, starts to say something twice, stops, can't think of what to say. Leaves Richie hanging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richie directs where cameras should be concealed. AGENTS SCHMIDT AND STOCK FOLLOW MAKING NOTES IN PADS. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can put a camera here. And we get it all on film. You like it? EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Schmidt) Give me those flowers. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we put the flower base here and put a camera in there we can get a clear shot of the couch there where we can put the congressmen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irving, sitting on the couch, looks kind of disturbed by this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right. That's the idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Carmine will go to jail after he delivers us the congressmen soon to be felons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carmine's aid MELORA answers a ringing phone as Carmine s at his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congressman O'Connell is on the phone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got to take this you guys everyone out please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolly Polito, checking the unwatered plants in her husban office with her coat on, she has just stopped by. Turns a holds up a parched and dying houseplant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is sad. It's just sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dolly please, I gotta take this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok, sorry. Everyone out. Go out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (picks up phone) Congressman, how you doing? It's Carmine. Tell me you're gonna be in Trenton this week. We have an amazing investment opportunity I'd like to discuss with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richie on a black and white surveillance camera as he sho the briefcase full of money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm federal agent Richard Dimaso. I've placed seventy-five thousand dollars into this briefcase for Representative John O'Connell of the Ninth District.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carmine shakes hands with REP. JOHN O'CONNELL --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congressman, thank you for coming by, John --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Representative O'Connell was contacted by Carmine Polito to ask if he could obtain rapid citizenship through an act of Congress for one Sheik Abdullah, investor. They walk up the capitol steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna talk jobs, investment, construction, if we can expedite a very wealthy man's citizenship --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 150   CAMERA PANS TO HOLE IN CORNER and CAMERA LENS -- 152

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How you doing congressmen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm excited to be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This brings the state back. I mean, how long we known each other?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARMINE POLITO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what this is gonna do for us? This is huge for the state of New Jersey. It stabilizes our economy. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hotels. Restaurants. It's waiting to happen. Carmine sees it, this fucking thing is waiting to happen. CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The goddamn bankers. Keeping their money on the sidelines. How we supposed to get anything done? JOHN O'CONNELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bankers only put money in the game when they can reap insane profit. Richie staring, mesmerized by this trap. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only problem is this citizenship situation. I mean, we got to expedite it as soon as possible. JOHN O'CONNELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well I'll tell you, you came to the right place. Everyone looks tense and on edge before. JOHN O'CONNELL (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll make it happen. CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, this is going to happen. Richie slides the briefcase in John's direction. CARMINE POLITO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is real. You understand? This is real. On my family. On my kids. On my life. On my work. JOHN O'CONNELL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that, Carmine. You're a good man This hurts Irving to see his friends sincerity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on grainy black and white) I'm federal agent Richard Dimaso. I am placing 75 thousand dollars in this brief case for one Representative Gerald Sanders of the 3rd district.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to do anything illegal-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please Gerry. Use it as a campaign donation. Whatever you want to do. Richie slides the briefcase to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on grainy monitor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm placing g $60,000 into an this brief case for one Congressman Eric Keshoygan of the 4th district --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to do what I can to help Carmine. Irv watches in pain as he sits with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A $100,000 into this briefcase for two term United States Senator Horton Mitchell of New Jersey. A distinguished silver haired Senator, older.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Atlantic City. All the way down the shore. A mecca by the sea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richie slides over the briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carmine you're beloved by your people. Your constituency is not even your constituency it's your family. That's what you represent, family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One small thing we do for this man is a huge thing we do for the people of New Jersey. This is what we can leave behind. Irving can't stand how hopeful his friend Carmine is bein because Irving knows Carmine is being set up. He gets up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irving what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (excusing himself uncomfortably)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just gotta go see a man about a dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on grainy monitor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate this. On my family. On my kids. This needs to happen. It's gotta happen. You've got my word Irving walks out of the room --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --into another room where Sydney on elegant gold couch, s alone. Surveillance equipment and room service trays are the coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She watches Irving who is pacing anxiously and very wound

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pacing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to save us. I want to save Carmine. It's fucking killing me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the only way to help Carmine is through the Tellegio thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dangerous. We gotta get a wire in there. We gotta make him feel safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's only one thing that can really fuck this up and that's your wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pacing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosalyn fixes Danny's coat, hands him his lunch and sends off towards the school's front door -- CLOSE UP: ROSALYN STARES INTO LENS. Emotional, a mixture sadness and hope. She holds a closed bottle of her favori nail finish and smells it nostalgically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gently puts a hand on her knee. She leaves it there fo moment before pushing it away. They stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETE MUSANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like your husband. You're no good together. He doesn't appreciate you. Hey, it happens. It happened in my marriage. That's why I went to Miami. Sometimes you just gotta be tough. You gotta stand up and you gotta leave, you know? Rosalyn looks at Pete smitten. PETE MUSANE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes you gotta let something die to let something live. You're too beautiful to be unhappy. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I mean, I don't want to badmouth my husband, but let me badmouth my husband for a second. He just thinks that he knows everything and he's so full of shit. He's such a liar. He thinks that I'm stupid, but I'm not stupid. I hear him on the phone arguing. He loves Carmine, but he hates that other guy, that curly- headed I.R.S. guy, or whatever who's carting around my husband's ex-lover, that redheaded whore. PETE MUSANE

dialogues.speaker: IRS
dialogues.text: ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyway. You can see that it drives him crazy. PETE MUSANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said IRS. What IRS guy? What are you talking bout? ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear them on the phone. I think that he's got Irv in some sort of bind or something and he's making him do all of this stuff and so Irv and Carmine right now are at the Plaza Hotel throwing away all this money at like Congress or whatever. They're giving money to congress or something. I don't really know but I overheard it on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pete's brow furrows - this is serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I hate to do this to you but I have to go talk to your husband. My boss is already angry. You stay here I'm going to give you some money for a taxi home. He puts cash in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (open, vulnerable)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't like change. It's really hard for me. Sometimes I think that I'll die before I change. He kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna be okay. You're gonna come live with me in Miami. Pete gets up and walks. As he does:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 164             Don't hurt him too bad. He's still Danny's father.

dialogues.text: Irv and Carmine down sidewalk leaving from The Plaza Hote Pete Musane stands next to an open passenger side door, - Irv and Carmine do not move, they stare at the open door.

dialogues.text: 170   Rosalyn in full muumuu, wearing cleaning gloves and vacuum sings to LIVE AND LET DIE while Danny sits on the couch watching her. Very intense.

dialogues.speaker: DIE" CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: Rosalyn continues to sing and gets more intense as the mu picks up.

dialogues.text: Irving looks over to Pete nervously. Unsure of what's goi to happen.

dialogues.speaker: DIE" CONTINUOUS
dialogues.text: Rosalyn whips her head up and down, dancing manically thr the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life is ridiculous and I would never say anything bad about your father in front of you but your father is a sick son of a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy's a sick son of a bitch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't repeat that. But yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irving's Caddy comes screeching up to the house and parks the driveway. Irv get's out and races inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosalyn is still sitting on the bed with Danny. IRVING ROSENFELD (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts)

dialogues.speaker: ROSALYN
dialogues.text: Rosalyn looks scared. IRVING ROSENFELD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a real low in our relationship! You know where I was recently? I was in your boyfriend's fucking car! I saw your nail polish.

dialogues.speaker: FINISH ON THE CAR SEAT
dialogues.text: WINDSHIELD SMELLS IT, WORRIED. Carmine glances over his shoulder anxiously at Dick Helsing in the back seat. PETE MUSANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this I hear about your curly haired friend working for the Government? CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?! Who said that? IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's bullshit! PETE MUSANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your wife. Irving is surprised to hear this. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's bullshit. CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosalyn?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screams)

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BACK SEAT.
dialogues.text: CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, what the fuck?! -- PETE MUSANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. Shut the fuck up. DICK HOLDS A GUN TO THE BACK OF IRVING'S BAGGED HEAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: TRYING TO KILL ME
dialogues.text: ROSALYN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?! IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: THINK YOU'RE DOING
dialogues.text: ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here! I'm not doing anything! IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: GOING TO GET US ALL KILLED
dialogues.text: Irving looks down to see Danny sitting there on the bed. IRVING ROSENFELD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny. Come here buddy alright? Go draw a picture or something. Irving ushers Danny out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a real sick son of a bitch for screaming at me like that in front of Danny. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: HE'LL KILL YOU.
dialogues.text: ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: STOP TALKING LIKE THAT
dialogues.text: IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a mobster alright? That's who you're dealing with. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright fine! Yes, I wanted to hurt you but how do you think that I feel all day when you leave me alone all day? And all I've ever wanted is for you to love me. That's all I ever wanted. And stay married and for you to love me. And that's why I'm going to Miami! IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're NOT going to Miami. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why I'm going to Miami with Pete! Irving picks up Rosalyn's clothes from the bed where ther an open suitcase, throws them back in the closet. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are NOT going to Miami. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I finally found somebody who loves me just like YOU always wanted. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too dangerous. Miami? Not now. Too dangerous. Irv continue to throw clothes back into the closet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He likes me just the way I am. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not now. Everything has to stay normal right now. And you're going to shut your mouth! ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told me that you wanted me to find a nice quiet man! IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh and what a DOOZY you picked! ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the one. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the most dangerous guy ever. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: CAN'T YOU JUST BE HAPPY FOR ME
dialogues.text: Irving reaches for his heart pills but they fall out of h hands and scatter on the floor. He bends down to grab the and almost falls. Rosalyn helps him up. ROSALYN ROSENFELD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why aren't you taking your heart pills? Irving, what's going on? What kind of trouble are you in?! What's happening? IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (out of breath) I've got a plan. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening? Irving coughs and steps back. Out of breath and very wind IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got a plan. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got a plan? When did you get it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It really fucking came to me when I was inside of that canvas bag with your boyfriend's hands around my throat. That's when it really came to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it off! Take the bag off his head! Dick pulls the bag off Irving's head, his comb over is al messed up. IRVING GASPS. Pete and Dick LAUGH --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got two million coming this week!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think this is? You think this is a fucking down payment plan? Like were Sears of Chevrolet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You ask Victor if he wants two million this week. That's real money. Two million.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two million? How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wired in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They LAUGH, Irving's hair is all messed up. Pete patches out. Irving and Carmine are a mess, shirts ripped open, no buttons, they look at each other VERY SHA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it true? Is it true what he said about your wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not fucking true. That's not true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can save all of us, and we can save money. I can take care of you and Danny. OK? But you gotta close your mouth. Rosalyn looks satisfied and points her finger at Irving. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew it. I have always said, Irving, that you are very, very hard to motivate properly. And I knew that Pete was gonna go over there and knock some sense into you. I've been reading this book, Irving. It's by Wayne Dyer, about the power of intention. Irving can't believe what he's hearing right now. Rosalyn, very satisfied, reaches over the bed and grabs a book. ROSALYN ROSENFELD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And my intention in sending Pete over to you was so that you could come up with this plan. So, you're welcome. Irving incredulous, thinks to himself how to respond. For himself to say gently -- IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. Thank you, Rosalyn. Thank you for the plan. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're welcome. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate that. So, I think that we should be partners on this. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a good partner. Almost better than Edith. You ever think about that? You ever think about how you might have underestimated me? IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what is our plan? Tell me the plan. What are you gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to keep my mouth shut and I'm not going to say anything but what do I do if Pete calls me? What am I supposed to say? IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta stop talking about your government agencies and your I.R.S. and your tax and your conspiracies and all of that. You're gonna say how you were wrong, you were wrong about that. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell Pete that I was wrong but you know that in real life, I was right for saying all that stuff because then that spurred on the actions that made you come up with this plan. So I will tell Pete. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holding his head) OK. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pointing with cigarette between fingers) The power of intention Irving. The power of intention. Irv is doing everything he can to hold it together. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK. You were right. Rosalyn gets up from the bed and walks over to Irving. IRVING ROSENFELD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so smart. Good job, peaches. ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irving, I've been doing a lot of thinking and -- you need to grow up. And you need to face the facts. And I think that both of us will be a lot happier if we get a divorce. As he listens to words he has been saying himself for mon now spoken as Rosalyn's idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just think about it. (kisses him) These things are never easy. Irving starts walking away towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irving. Good luck with your plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spare rhythmic intro of Jeff Lynne's "Long Black Road plays as Richie looks back over his shoulder and walks towards the building with intensity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Necessity truly is the mother of invention. The F.B.I. was willing to wire the two million dollars if it meant taking down Tellegio and his entire organization.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brenda in her office. Amado looking very pleased on the telephone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irving walks with Richie and Sydney up to an office build

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A mobster like Tellegio would never meet at the Plaza Hotel, but only at the office of his attorney, Alfonse Simone. They walk into mob lawyer Simone's building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On an old faded directory: 7TH FLOOR: ALFONSE SIMONE #701

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They open door to large, spare reception area of Alfonse Simone's law office. MIDDLE AGED SECRETARY looks up and p up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: ALFONSE SIMONE- 64, BRONX, SEASONED LAWYER.
dialogues.text: Alfonse Simone rises from behind his desk. A silent secre sitting at his side in a white dress stares at our heros Simone steps forward to introduce himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfonse Simone. Edith walks up to him to shake hands. He shakes hands wit Irving and Richie as well. Man in the suit closes the doo behind them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edith Greensly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irving Rosenfeld.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, be seated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They sit in three chairs facing Simone's desk: Sydney/Edi Richie, Irving. Simone sits behind his desk, the silent secretary sits ju behind him slightly to the side, stares at Edith, Richie, Irving. ALFONSE SIMONE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I appreciate the fact that you all came in person, but the trip was really unnecessary because this whole thing could have been done with a simple wire transfer. As a matter of fact this is the number of our wire right here. Simone slides a small pink piece of paper across the desk them. Richie stares at the paper, but doesn't touch it. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where is Mr. Tellegio? ALFONSE SIMONE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Tellegio unfortunately was called out of town on business. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not good. We were willing to come here today, in person, to see Mr. Tellegio, as a sign of respect to give two million dollars -- ALFONSE SIMONE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can assure you that I have the power of attorney -- RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. If you'll let me finish, we are willing to give two million dollars today of the ten. But without Mr. Tellegio here -- IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Simone) We can't, we can't make that decision. It's not the right thing. It's not the right time. It's just not good. EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Irving across Richie) You don't have the authorization to make this kind of choice so don't be hasty, alright?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not being hasty. It's just, let's be smart about it. This is not how we do business. (to Simone) I'm sorry. I apologize. Richie motions with his hand to Edith that he agrees with Irving. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's right, we can't. EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you should hang in there. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what? The guy's not here. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He isn't. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. He stands, goes to the door. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a surprise. The Sheik doesn't like surprises. Edith turns in her chair to face them in the doorway. EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't leave. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in doorway with Richie) Edith, this is not your decision to make. EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understand but maybe we can call the Sheik. Let's call the Sheik. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not the plan. That's not the -- Edith locks eyes with Richie. Richie stares at Edith, wav Irving off with his hand. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, let's -- I'll call the Sheik. (to Simone) Can I use your phone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALFONSE SIMONE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please do. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Alfonse Simone) I don't know if he's in, I'll call the Sheik. But before I do, I'd like to go over specifically what this money will be used for. ALFONSE SIMONE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What we will do is we guarantee all proper licenses and construction permits for any hotel casino that plans to open before the end of the year. Richie glances down at Edith and her handbag. PUSH IN ON

dialogues.speaker: EDITH'S GUCCI BAG.
dialogues.text: ALFONSE SIMONE (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And we'll throw in the customary privileges and protection. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if there are obstacles, what will you do? ALFONSE SIMONE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obstacles? We are prepared to overcome any obstacles. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a big enterprise. ALFONSE SIMONE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we have to pay somebody off, we'll pay somebody off. If we have to lean on somebody, intimidate somebody, we'll intimidate somebody. We're experienced. This is our business. RICHIE STARES AT SIMONE. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's powerful stuff. Thank you. IRVING STARES AND SYDNEY LOOKS AT RICHIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALFONSE SIMONE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'll tell you something else. At the end of this we'll teach you how to skim and how to cut it up and make some money on the side. Because we invented skimming. We've been doing it for thirty years. A smile creeps across Richie's face. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you. Thank you for clarifying that. Richie picks up the phone to dial. RICHIE DIMASO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that will be OK for the Sheik.

dialogues.speaker: AMADO, STODDARD, BRENDA.
dialogues.text: ANTHONY AMADO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the Sheik. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone) Mr. Tellegio is not here. It's just Mr. Alfonse Simone, his lawyer. Are we still ok to wire the money? ALFONSE SIMONE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simone can take the money. What's the number? RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: 5317AP
dialogues.text: Amado writes it down and hands it to Brenda to call in. BRENDA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The funds have been transferred. ANTHONY AMADO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on phone to Richie) The funds have been transferred. Amado nods: victory. BACK TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richie hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The money's been wired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we have a deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes we do sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pleasure doing business with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, well, thank you very much, Mr. Simone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Sheik's very excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure that we'll be seeing each other. Richie and team start to walk out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (grinning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I'm sure we'll be seeing each other very soon. You may even get sick of me, like these two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I'll get sick of you. Nice meeting you. Richie, Edith, and Irving walk down the hall after leavin his office. Richie smiles as the opening of Bowie's "The Genie" momentously starts. Edith smiles as she walks down hall followed by Irving. Richie puts his hand on the door knob to exit the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts through clamor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're ambitious, that's why! Richie suddenly moves to the reel to reel surveillance ta and quiets the room, the music momentarily stops as we he Alfonse Simone on the surveillance tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shh, shh, shh!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we have to pay somebody off, we'll pay somebody off. If we have to lean on somebody, intimidate somebody, we'll intimidate somebody. Richie joyfully lip synchs to the rhythm of Simone's incriminating words on tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in unison with Simone on tape)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- If we have to lean on somebody, intimate somebody, we'll intimidate somebody!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irving's big blue car pulls up to the lens. Irving and Sy looking a little uneasy. Irving stares at the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean, there's no sheik? What does that mean, "there's no sheik"? What does that mean? Carmine stares at Irving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to face you like a man because I want to be real now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is "they"? Irving looks distressed. He's a wreck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the Feds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Feds?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irving -- I'm a good person

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are! Carmine stands up and looks around the room, disoriented, life passing before his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been doing this for a long time, for twenty years. Do you think I woulda taken that money if it wasn't the right thing to do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey look, you're a good person I know that but in all honesty -- CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screams) You said that was the only way, Irv. You chased me, remember? IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They fuckin' made me do it. What was I supposed to do? They had Syd in jail. CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made me go back to the Plaza to take that money, you piece of shit! I was gone! You fucking prick! CARMINE BEATS IRVING DOWN ON THE COUCH. CARMINE POLITO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was gone, I left! DOLLY WALKS IN. DOLLY POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is everything alright? Can I have a word with you? CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very upset) No, please, Dolly, just go upstairs. Take the kids and go upstairs! DOLLY POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, alright. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to make this right. I came here because I want to make it right. Irving is in tears. Very upset. CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at my face. You tell me that I'm lying to you when I say that everything I do is for the good of the people of New Jersey. Everything I do is for them. Am I lying to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never had a friend like you before. CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used that money for the goddamn casino. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got some leverage, alright? I can help you out. CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all shit. It's all bullshit. Carmine picks up the knife the Sheik gave him. CARMINE POLITO (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this thing. Look at this. Ceremonial fucking knife. What is this bullshit? Some toy? He drops it on the table. Irving stares at his friend, removes his glasses. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carmine, Syd and I got a plan for you. We can help you out. CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please get out of my house, Irving. Will you please leave? I'm asking you nicely, please leave. Irving gets up to go and is pushed towards the door by Carmine. Dolly joins Carmine in tears. Carmine's kids sta on the stairs. DOLLY POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of our house! IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to -- (seeing kids) I'm sorry. I didn't mean for this to happen. CARMINE POLITO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to kids) This is not our friend! IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Truly, I didn't mean for this to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carmine points to his family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what matters to me most and you're crushing it! You're going to take me away from them you fucking son of a bitch? Get the fuck out! 183   Carmine lunges at Irving and punches him in the fac goes down to the ground and his glasses fly off his face. CARMINE kicks him one last time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beaten, bloody on floor)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to make it right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of my house. Look what you made me do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stumbling out the door)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry Carmine, I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irving staggers out of the house in an emotional daze, on hand to his heart, falls to sidewalk with bloody nose and broken glasses -- SYDNEY ACROSS THE STREET BURST OUT OF THE CAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irving!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your heart pills. Where are your heart pills? She digs through his pockets, finds the pills, and feeds to him. Sydney struggles to help Irving to his feet and together, embattled but surviving couple, they cross the street arm arm. She opens the door and helps him into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to lay down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just rest. She gets in and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both slump down on the seat, stare at each other, emotional, humbled. Sydney gently removes Irving's broken glasses. They stare at each other, it is quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (emotional, quiet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. They stare at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. She squeezes his hand, raises it to her lips and kisses i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please. Come in. Sit down. They all sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know where our two million dollars is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two million? (Irving pushes his new glasses up the bridge of his nose) It's with Victor Tellegio and Alfonse Simone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, actually it's not with Victor Tellegio or Alfonse Simone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richie stands by the window, stares angrily at Irving. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fucking knows about it. ANTHONY AMADO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gone missing. Did you know that? IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's it gone? ANTHONY AMADO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's interesting that you said that because while you were on your way over here, we got an anonymous phone call from someone who said that in exchange for immunity for the two of you and a reduced sentence for Carmine Polito we get our two million dollars back. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's interesting. That's very interesting. I have no idea. ANTHONY AMADO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No idea? IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No idea what you're talking about. Irving looks at Sydney who looks back at him and shakes h head. She doesn't know either. ANTHONY AMADO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got it. I understand how these deals are made. See, someone has leverage. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anthony, fuck them. It's over. We got them for wire fraud, it's over. (to Irving and Sydney) You're done. You're both done. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you don't think so?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard, think about it, YOU requested the two million. And you gave Brenda the account number. We didn't do any of that. None of it. (turns dramatically to face Richie) How do we know that YOU don't have the money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Richie looks from Irving to Sydney)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I living in a fucking nightmare right now? AMADO AND STODDARD STARE INCRIMINATINGLY AT RICHIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I find this a little offensive. Really, I find this a little offensive and I don't see that you got any sort of solid case against--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Amado and Stoddard) Don't let him get in your heads. Listen to me, we're dealing with a very clever individual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard, think about it. You got some big arrests. You got U.S. Congressmen. You look good. You're gonna be all over the news. You know what doesn't look good? A story about gross incompetence

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a warrant for -- Richie looks around disoriented, we cannot see what he se yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, do I have the wrong office?(checks number on the door) Is this 701? Alfonse Simone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MAN'S VOICE (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is 701.

dialogues.speaker: APPEARED TO BE THE DESK OF LAWYER ALFONSE SIMONE.
dialogues.text: BLACK DIVORCE LAWYER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Roger Thigpen. I've had this office for 25 years. I'm a divorce attorney. RICHIE IS STUNNED.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SYDNEY PROSSER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lost two million dollars of taxpayer money because you were confused about the location and the identity of Victor Tellegio's attorney?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where we first saw Irving at the pool party. IRVING ROSENFELD (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The role of Tellegio's attorney, Alfonse Simone, was played by our friend Ed Malone -- Camera pans from Irving to Ed Malone: IRVING ROSENFELD (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: the "Cold Cut King of Long Island"-- Ed Malone holds up two packages of cold cuts. Also holdin the cold cuts are the two that frisked everyone at Simone office. IRVING ROSENFELD (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whose party we were at when Sydney and I first met. Cut to Irving first meeting Sydney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed Malone, dressed as Alfonse Simone, steps to camera to shake Richie's hand. ED MALONE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alfonse Simone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EDITH GREENSLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People believe what they want to believe Richie. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's because you conned me! You both fucking conned me. You both got under me. You did! IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well that doesn't sound so good, either. I mean -- and I don't know what you're talking about, but -- let's just assume you want to go with that story. Really? That's the story you want to go with? That's what you want the New York Times to hear? That you got conned by the very con men who you forced to entrap the members of Congress in the first place. That's what you want to go with? That doesn't sound so good for your whole thing. Richie looks like he's going to be sick. IRVING ROSENFELD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And how ironic that the most creative minds, the ones who are working hardest to get the economy of New Jersey going, those are the ones that you round up. And why? Because what, they're the easiest to go after? And what about the real bullshit artists? You didn't even come close to the big leagues. Those big guys. The money men. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I was trying to go after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to tell you, you got none of 'em. STODDARD THORSEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Richard, I think we may call you as a witness, but otherwise you're done. I think you better go home. Richie disoriented, appeals to Stoddard. RICHIE DIMASO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stoddard -- STODDARD THORSEN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on home, Richard. ELO's "10538 Overture" reprises on the soundtrack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera tilts down from the Federal Building to find Richi coming down the stairs, emotional. Richie walks wiping hi eyes, his innocence and Edith, lost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IRVING ROSENFELD (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We took down some very big guys.

dialogues.speaker: -REP. SIMMONS ESCORTED OUT OF CITY HALL.
dialogues.text: IRVING ROSENFELD (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some of whom were just doing business as usual helping their communities or their states.

dialogues.speaker: GROCERY STORE PARKING LOT WITH A BAG FULL OF GROCERIES.
dialogues.text: IRVING ROSENFELD (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But some of them knew they had larceny in their blood--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they even admitted it. GREY HAIRED SENATOR HORTON MITCHELL, wife by his side, de any wrongdoing and is photographed and humiliated as he t sits with her in a Federal car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But in all it was six Congressmen, one United States Senator, and my friend, Carmine Polito.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gave the two million back so Carmine got the reduced sentence. 18 months. The loss of his friendship would haunt me for the rest of my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when the story was written, Richard Dimaso's name was never mentioned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Syd and I moved in together. And Rosalyn -- ROSALYN IN A NECK BRACE and off white trench coat and sunglasses -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car is a little dinged up and I'm a little stiff but I don't want to talk about it. Irving stares at Rosalyn. IRVING ROSENFELD (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She would always be interesting. Rosalyn gets in to a car, revealing Pete Musane in the driver's seat. Irving leans in. PETE MUSANE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Irving) You know my boss knows you did him a solid. IRVING ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I did. He never took a nickle so they can't get him for nothing. I was never going to let that happen. Irving starts to leave -- ROSALYN ROSENFELD

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irv. He stops and looks at her. With red lacquered nails Rosal places her favorite nail finish in his hand. ROSALYN ROSENFELD (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm done with this nail finish. Bye for now. I'll see you next weekend. Irving nods. Rosalyn drives off with Pete. Sydney stands with Danny. IRVING ROSENFELD (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our conning days were behind us. Irving and Sydney walk hand and hand with Danny down the street. Irv drops the nail finish into a trashcan. IRVING ROSENFELD (V.O.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can fool yourself for just so long and then your next reinvention better have your damn feet on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irving and Sydney admire a piece of art on the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got a loan from a bank and were able to go gallery legitimate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Irving and Sydney sit in front of a banker asking for a l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The art of survival is a story that never ends.

dialogues.speaker: SYDNEY PLACES THE NEEDLE ON THE RECORD PLAYING ON A
dialogues.text: TURNTABLE: DUKE ELLINGTON'S JEEPS BLUES, begins. SHE STAR ACROSS THE ROOM AT IRVING. IRVING STARES BACK HER.
